Cell phone cameras are great for sharing stuff with friends but if you want quality that is not as detailed as a pro camera but better then the average "consumer" camera this would be a good match.  which to me makes it useful for photographers as well. just because its a compact doesnt mean you really have to compromise too much (unless you are into manual settings) but i have found using a DSLR vs this camera this one is actually a lot easier to use simply because for the most part its auto mode works perfect, even my canon Rebel XTi had problems with yellowing pictures inside with no flash on auto mode, i usually rarely ever had that problem with the 300 HS and from what i seen so far same with the 110 HS. so think about that. this camera has a better auto mode then some 600 buck DSLR cameras(now i am not saying that for the current Canon DSLR cameras i would hope they would have an updated auto mode too as time has passed)but basically all you need to do with this camera is point and shoot and frame the image right and you'll get great photos that will wow your friends! and great video as well!and the plus with the video as with the Canon 110 HS is the video mode is true 24p which for videographers is a nice plus because it will make the videos look a tad step up from the average compact camera video!also one tip if you have a HD TV or a widescreen 16:9 computer moniter you can set the photos to 16:9 which will make them fit when viewed back on those displays easily (or if you want to integrate them into your HD video using a video editor too!) it can also shoot in other aspect ratios which makes the options nice.also of note the slow motion mode (i didnt test it on here but it should be the same as the 300 HS) is really fun as well!for the size and price you really cant go wrong with this camera, just one suggestion is to get a nice little case for it (the one thats listed with the product underneath works great) to keep it safe and thats what I should have got for my last one haha :-)Somehow i think even though its only just a bit better then the 300 HS its going to inspire to do more video and photos :-) and with the holidays coming up this is the best time to get it!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic, simple camera
Reviews.Author: mary_h
Reviews.Content: I can't say how pleased I am with this camera. The quality of the pictures are superb, and the 5x optical zoom is great for getting clear shots of subjects that are further away. The different camera modes are also fun to play with, haha. The battery life is a little short, though, but that's easily remedied by purchasing a couple of spare batteries.I purchased this camera primarily to have a good way to capture my adventures when I study abroad in London this fall, and I don't have any reason to believe that this won't be up for the task! It's compact, easy to use, and gives you great quality photos. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Not as good as previous Powershots
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd powershot.  I bought it because I've loved them in the past, but this one is a definite step down.  It seems to have trouble maintaining focus during videos and kept going back and forth between focusing on the subject and some random thing in the background--who cares if I get 1080p if it is blurry.  The battery is pretty weak whereas previous Powershots had amazing stamina.  My biggest complaint however, is that after only a few weeks of using it I started getting a clicking when zooming and from time to time the lens cover wouldn't open fully and I'd get the dreaded 'lens error' message.  Thankfully, I was within the return period.  I love many things about Canons, but if they can't get the basics like good focus, then I don't care how many different modes it has (but the movie digest mode is pretty cool).

Reviews.Title: Pavillion Electronics Sent Me A Used One
Reviews.Author: Benjamin
Reviews.Content: This is no knock on the Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera, especially since I didn't use it but returned it immediately.  Disappointing to say the least. Order a new camera and get a used one with scratched logo and corners. No sealed packaging and the battery was missing. Thanks Pavilion Electronics!  And thanks Amazon for making returns easy.

Reviews.Title: Quality of the pictures are only okay
Reviews.Author: bubs2014
Reviews.Content: Love the looks of this camera since red is my favorite color. Aside from that, it's really not worth buying, since I can take better photos with my iphone 5s. Save your money if you have a smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: FaerieChar
Reviews.Content: I love the camera. It isn't for a pro photographer but for the average person just wanting to make snapshots, it is perfect. Also, the perfect size to fit into your pocket or purse. Makes nice pictures and came in PINK.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Karin L.
Reviews.Content: I actually have 2 of these cameras. I bought the first one in blue about 2 years ago (the price was much lower then) and loved it so much bought a second one in pink about a year ago (only paid $139) The pics are sharp and clear ..absolutely love the wide angle lens..takes great pics in low light. its tiny, light, but very well made..you can't go wrong with this camera.

Reviews.Title: incredible picture
Reviews.Author: Amy Sulstrom
Reviews.Content: I have bought many many cameras in my day and this is one of my favorites. Being a mom I wanted a good quality camera in my purse and this I reach for often more than any others.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian E.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy using this camera.  It takes great pictures and is compact enough to carry with you on all trips.

Reviews.Title: Excellent produce, great travel camera
Reviews.Author: Rob in Denver
Reviews.Content: I've taken a few thousand photos with this great little camera.  I also have a Canon 60D, but this little one is so portable and accurate that I can't help but carry this with me on trips that I DONT want to carry a large camera.  The outer protective design works great.  I've dropped this camera, no damage.  Very portable and slim, it fits into my pants pocket making it very convenient and much easier to use than my Galaxy S3 phone camera (which does take decent pictures).  Very fast start-up, with flexible settings, this is a "no regrets" purchase.  I highly recommend it.  Canon is a great company building great products.

Reviews.Title: Best Point and Shoot with HD video
Reviews.Author: J. Comeaux "AudioBook Fan Extraordinaire"
Reviews.Content: I have owned a few Point and Shoot cameras with Video. I used to prefer the Kodak cameras because of the easy-to-understand buttons and controls. THen I compared a Kodak with a Canon (comparable models, same picture taken side by side). The Kodak was visibly inferior, which I took to be the lens. The Canon picture was sharp and clear, and the flash is also superior. I highly recommend the Canon. Only issues i have are 1) i accidentally push the "Off" button instead of the shutter button, maybe my fingers are too big, and 2) i was putting my finger on the tiny microphone hole and so the resulting videos were nosy and muted until i figured it out. Now i have to hold the camera to not cover the hole. Those are both things I can get used to.

Reviews.Title: Best deal for a snap shot
Reviews.Author: Tomtom
Reviews.Content: These refurbished cameras are like new, maybe they are new. They come with USB cable, charger, battery, strap, and CD-Rom. The camera is so much better than most of the newer models. Some features like HDR or automatic panorama are missing but you cannot have it all. The biggest drawback is that the camera struggles a lot with high contrast scenes  (shadow and sun).  The biggest plus is that the automatic mode really works and you can take real snapshots. Also the video quality is excellent. Some other cameras have Full HD but are not capable of dealing with it.

Reviews.Title: Professional Photographer's Opinion
Reviews.Author: Brian Heckman
Reviews.Content: I am a professional photographer and I wanted my wife to have a versatile, all purpose camera she could use to take high quality photos without having to lug around a lot of heavy, high dollar gear. We have owned the last 3 models of this popular little powershot and I can say without reservation this is the finest yet! It is compact, VERY easy to use and truly surprised me with it's powerful performance.The resolution it achieves with a sensor this size is impressive, easily rivaling much more expensive Digital SLR's. It's above average performance in low light was a welcome surprise, it's flash refresh time was more than adequate, it focuses quickly and it has no lag time whatsoever when pressing the magic button to snap your shot!Above all, the icing on this cake is the superb image quality. Details are sharp and colors are true.If you are looking for a quality camera at a great price, it doesn't get any better than this!

Reviews.Title: Alright
Reviews.Author: J. R. Wallace
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I'm spoiled with my DSLR, but this camera takes forever to refresh to take the next picture.  The quality of the pictures are good and I like the HD video

Reviews.Title: Cute
Reviews.Author: Monique "Desiree Monique Hernandez"
Reviews.Content: I love it! It is cute and girly but not over the top, just right, takes really good pictures and cuter in person! Money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Battery
Reviews.Author: bruce duffy
Reviews.Content: The battery only holds the charge for a short period of time before it needs recharging.  I would think that Canon would manufacture a higher quality battery.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Darrel
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.The pictures are clear, and it is easy to use. I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Justin Bastev
Reviews.Content: Takes very good high quality pictures. Really good quality at night. Very nice screen to view the pics on after taking them. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot camera
Reviews.Author: Leslie
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  My pictures are clear and bright.  I'm not a photographer, just someone who would like to take nice family pictures, and this camera works great.

Reviews.Title: Bought this for my daughter, then bought one for me!
Reviews.Author: Anne B.
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera, especially for the price.  I bought if for a gift for my daughter and I kept borrowing it, so I got one for me.The pictures are great quality. Lots of cool features I have not figured out yet. My daughter uses the one that takes a black and white and then allows one color of your choice.  So everything is b & W except anything blue.  Very cool.The only thing I don't like and I don't know if I have the setting wrong, but there seems to be a lapse from when I press the button and the photo snaps.  So action shots are tough.Also takes video.I definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Just What I Wanted
Reviews.Author: Blake Roche
Reviews.Content: My mom had a Canon PowerShot earlier model that she unfortunately dropped in the water the other year. She and I both loved it because it took incredibly crisp and incredibly colorful photos for a point and shoot. After getting a Nikon to replace it (absolute garbage), we'll only be buying Canon ever again. After doing a ton of research online, I went to some local stores to give a few of the best I'd read about a test run. Not surprisingly...the stores didn't have any of these best-reviewed of the internet. They had the newer model ELPH, and I liked the feel of the camera and the look of the few shots I could take.This camera was absolutely everything I wanted out of the camera for my mom - quick, colorful, crisp, easy to use, great auto mode with focus-tracking and face-tracking. My only fear was that this supercompact camera would be too small, but once I unpacked it and used it to take a couple photos, I decided it had a great size. An absolute buy if you're in the market for a great point-and-shoot. ALWAYS BUY CANON.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice!
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: I had the same camara which I received as a gift 4 years ago. I loved that camara and even though there was nothing wrong with it, I wanted to update. This new model is sleek and light and it takes a great clear shot! I recommend it for people like me who are not into the big fancy camaras, but likes to take pictures that are clear and bright! This is a uncomplicated camara and I love it!

Reviews.Title: got this little camera for a race
Reviews.Author: Maroon
Reviews.Content: I ran a 50K and wanted  a light camera to have during the run, the powershot worked so great, it is very easy to use, pictures are amazing even better than my Eos, it is light and very user friendly, I figured it out in an hour. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: A low light pic I took looks WAY better than in real life!! ---
Reviews.Author: craigery
Reviews.Content: I have always had Canon digital cameras, and am consistently pleased and impressed with the results!  One of my first "test" pics with this camera in a low light situation of some cactus came out absolutely stunning!  Likewise, some "test" movies I made of my kids in an indoor skating rink with poor lighting came out extremely clear and accurately auto focused EXCEPT at digital zoom levels.There is, however, some zoom motor noise on movies.  Not a dealbreaker, but could be improved.Again, the visuals were impressive and even stunning.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera for the money :)
Reviews.Author: Daniel Scholler "Love God. Live Truth."
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this to anyone who likes a camera with the versatility of a great video feature. The pictures and video come out great!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Steve Sandman
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use, clear pictures, fast startup and shutdown.  Can not wait to take more pictures with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Mags
Reviews.Content: Love the compact size and user friendly features, photos are excellent clarity...yes, I still process hard copy photos!Made the selection based on reviews in a consumer magazine and really happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Point & Shoot?  No, Point & Pray!
Reviews.Author: L. K. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Cam arrived, intact, well packed, and is as advertised.  Great little pocket cam (had to pay extra for red color - why?).  And, still, Canon idiotically refuses to put any kind of viewfinder on their point&shoot; cams. Should be called point&pray.;  Try using it in sunlight!  I live in AZ.  Get the picture?  I don't... at least not on the LCD monitor. Otherwise, terrific small cam to carry for everyday use.  Put a tiny viewfinder on it and it would be 5 stars.  PS: Great HD video!

Reviews.Title: Great price, great price.
Reviews.Author: rllrbldr
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a damaged ELPH 100.  All the controls buttons are familiar. Added features are +4 megapixels and the ability to zoom the lens while video recording.  Great compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Angry Ryan "Ryan A. Forrest"
Reviews.Content: I traded in a Sony which performed similar to this one but was a little more difficult to use. This interface is simple, takes great pictures, and has a nice price tag.

Reviews.Title: It's ok.
Reviews.Author: lin e bredenfoerder
Reviews.Content: Lightweight! Easily fits in a pocket.View screen is huge, although it doesn't move like the screen on the Cannon A80 which is inconvenient.  Also definitely need a case as the viewscreen will scratch easily.Really is a point & shoot camera.Have a Cannon A80. Controls are similar so the switch was easy.Indoor pictures are tinted yellow, not easily filxed by autofix in the photo printing program and the corrections that can be made are limited in scope.  However, I can use PhotoImpression 6 which I have on my computer to make many more corrections for decent, if not great pix.  Uploaded pix using program provided on CD.  Not user friendly. Kept uploading pix I have stored on my computer.  Once I got the test pix uploaded the transition to being able to edit kept failing and taking me back to previously stored pix.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It's lightweight and takes great pictures.  The only thing, is it does not automatically download videos.  I have to buy a special cord for downloading videos.

Reviews.Title: Very useful
Reviews.Author: A. C. Van Milligen
Reviews.Content: I wanted an easy point and shoot camera and was astounded by its capabilities. The extensive manual (over 200 pages) was a surprise. I have taken many pictures of families. I had trouble transferring pictures from the camera to my PC. It seems that the procedure was outdated in the manual and did not work. I finally was able to make the transfers after much trrouble.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: shadowdog
Reviews.Content: Small & compact camera.5 power optical zoom with a reasonable but not overwhelming amount of programing.Takes great pictures.The LCD display is a bit grainy but the pictures are sharp & clear.Great little pocket camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: This camera and its multi photo snapshot quickness and easy to understand functions has made it possible for me to forever have a copy of my grandsons first steps!!! I forever will be grateful!

Reviews.Title: Awesome piece
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Great camera! I really love it, it takes great pics, it has great functions it's really worth the price paid!

Reviews.Title: Poor battery but excellent images
Reviews.Author: E. Shipman "EShipman"
Reviews.Content: The battery drains quickly but may have been due to cold weather. Really like the nighttime scene. Used available light in the evening to get shots that I could not get with my previous camera. Cannot figure out the "P" scene as there are no selection attributes. Like the size of the camera, easy to carry and hold. Wide angle lens is good. Fun camera. Considering buying a second battery.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Fernando H. Oliva "blazehi"
Reviews.Content: its the most wonderful digital camera i ve ever bought , its handy, easyy to use, very smart functions, its incredible

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed at a great value! Already purchased another!
Reviews.Author: Sysouda Yabandith
Reviews.Content: I recently lost my camera and I love to take pictures for memories sake as well as record my favorite songs at concerts. I'm not a photographer, but like to edit my pictures and I appreciate the difference in quality between the 16.1 MP on this camera as compared to my previous 12ish MP Canon Powershot ELPH 100HS. The images are very vibrant and clear, and the HD quality video recording capabilities inspire me to take on other projects. You will definitely want to purchase a memory card that can hold all of this however, since the camera does not come with one at all. I got a 16GB memory card that should hold about 3738 images at the largest size 16M 4608x3456 (16x20), 7306 8M 3264x2448 (13x19), 9999 2M 1600x1200 (postcard size), and 9999 at the smallest 0.3M  640x480 (email attachments). As for full HD recordings at 1920x1080, you can record up to 58 minutes. I don't plan to record at any less of a quality than that, but as you can imagine your minutes will increase as you decrease your quality settings. This is the perfect camera and value for someone who wants something for everyday use and to travel with. It's sleek and compact, and user friendly! I want to keep it safe and prolong it's use, so I bought a carrying case for it as well. I can't believe this camera and the accessories I purchased for it are all under the price of even half of what my previous camera cost me. I've decided to spread the love and ordered the same camera and accessories for someone else because I love it so much!

Reviews.Title: highly capable little camera
Reviews.Author: Patrick S. Armstrong "armstr54"
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS is extraordinarily capable given its small size and extremely affordable price.  HD video is unbelievably clear, and well appointed photographs are nearly effortless in auto mode.The primary drawback to this camera is the small size of the control buttons.  The top of the buttons are actually seated beneath the frame of the camera.  This makes toggling through the extensive menu settings extremely difficult, especially for people with larger fingers.  The plastic battery housing also appears very cheap and detracts from the overall attractiveness of the camera.If not for the undersized control buttons (a fatal error), this camera would easily rate five stars.  I recommend delaying purchase in the hopes that Canon will resolve this design shortcoming in the 110 HS' successor.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: John Jason Gulley
Reviews.Content: Amazon shipping was fast! So far the camera has met my expectations. Easy to understand user interface and the picture quality is about what I expected.The auto feature takes really good photos and the ease with which you can take great shots is about par with most upper level quality point and shoot cameras. If you need an easy to use, quality point and shoot camera that fits right into a jacket or cargo pocket, this is a great choice. To sum it up, small camera that has better than average quality photo quality. You want to take pics with your iPhone, go ahead. If you want to take better pics than that, use this nifty camera instead.

Reviews.Title: Just recieved it. .
Reviews.Author: Katelyn
Reviews.Content: I just recieved it in the mail, and honestly.. I already love it. I seriously love it. It focuses amazing on both settings. It has good quality pictures,and the filming is awesome. I would repurchase it in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Lovell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for my recent vacation I took. I wanted something small that I could tuck in a pocket or purse, but something that would also take good pictures.  I just left it on auto the whole time and my pictures turned out great.  I even took some pics as we were in a moving vehicle and they turned out rather well.  I would recommend this camera for anyone looking for a simple point and click camera.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Alexei
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, takes nice pictures and video, and very convenient to carry around. I did a lot of homework before choosing this model and am glad I did.

Reviews.Title: among the best of the pocket cameras
Reviews.Author: PacNW
Reviews.Content: Very good. Easy to use, reliably good image quality. Fits in any pocket. I'm very happy with it.The bad: older Elph cameras had bigger batteries that lasted longer. This one has such a tiny battery that doesn't last very long per charge. I'd rather a slightly larger camera with a longer-lasting battery. Loses one star for this.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera - Great Vlogging Camera For YouTube!!!
Reviews.Author: Gift Card Recipient
Reviews.Content: Great price, great thin camera.  This is one of the most popular, if not the most popular vlogging camera amongst YouTuber's.  ShayCarl, TyMoss, PirateGray, and others use this camera and I can see why.  Easy to use, not too bulky and great quality video and sound.  If you're an inspiring vlogger, this is the camera to get.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my husband.  He was very appreciating, but scared to use it as he is not very good with instructions.  I read them and showed him how to use it, he really likes it now.  Easy to use and explain how to use.  A wonderful camera for people who are not camera inclined.  Takes fabulous pictures of our new Grandson.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Pam Feinschil
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, compact and sharp. If I have to write more words I may not do this feedback again. I'm Sorry.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Pape
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Christmas, she loves it. Takes great pictures and easy to use. It took a great picture of a car speeding by at about 60 mph, no blurring and crystal clear image. Amazing!!

Reviews.Title: Main Use: Camcorder with nice photos
Reviews.Author: BK
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take some nice videos and I was having the hardest time choosing between a camcorder or a regular camera. I wanted something simple to upload to YouTube and would take nice video.Pros:It definitely takes sharp looking full HD video and great pictures.I could upload straight from camera to YouTube!Very simple to use especially if you asked a friend to film something for you . . . no explanation required. . . just hit the button.Cons:This will be the main issues with any camera that you want to act as a camcorder. . .Battery doesn't last to to long for video (I bought two more battery packs offline for about $25)Doesn't come with SD memory chip (This camera seems to take any SD chip. I got a 32GB for $23 offline)Optical Zoom is X5 (After looking into cameras I found that DIGITAL zoom really should not be used, it just makes the quality of your picture go down, ok fine so I use my OPTICAL zoom which keeps 100% of the quality, but it is only 5X on this camera, but it is also only a Camera and not a Camcorder. After looking back at everything I found most Cameras bellow $250 will be around 3X-8X Optical zoom. I sometimes need to film things from a reasonable distance away, maybe 220 feet, which the 5X Optical seems to be reasonable enough for. If you need to film from a 200+ feet away often and are going to be picky at how close you need it to be zoomed in on the actually item itself then your best option will be to look into a Camcorder as they tend to have a ridiculous amount of optical zoom.)Conclusion:All in all the camera is a great choice whether you want a perfect photo or a beautiful video within 200 feet. After spending the extra $50 dollars on batteries and memory card (totaling everything to about $200) I should be able to get roughly 1.5hours -2hours of HD video depending on how often I start and stop.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Susan Kostic
Reviews.Content: Loved the simplicity of this camera.  Anyone who is a bit technology impaired will love this camera.  I took it to Jamaica for my daughters wedding and it produced some beautiful photos!!

Reviews.Title: fantastic product
Reviews.Author: dennis pulchan
Reviews.Content: i am totally satsfied with this product as it serves my immediate needs and exceeds my expectations. The qualtity of pictures are of an unsually high quality.

Reviews.Title: awsome camera
Reviews.Author: Jean M. Fetty
Reviews.Content: i love this camera! I needed a new camera and bought this cannon,it takes wonderful pictures,and is easy to learn to use

Reviews.Title: Love it, as I always do with Canon
Reviews.Author: Dalton
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this for a point and shoot to anybody. Great price for what it has to offer! This does not feel as strong as my previous Canon (which I ironically broke the lense on when I dropped) but still very sturdy, for as thin as it is. The screen is definitely big enough and clear as day. I love almost everything about it but if I had to pick out something to pick on, I would say the low-light shots are not the best.All in all, if this is in your price range, get it:D

Reviews.Title: A really nice camera
Reviews.Author: courtneyshea
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice camera for the price. I needed a new point and shoot, easy to use camera to take pictures of holidays and various family get-togethers and this fits the bill perfectly. I love the color (light pink) and the rechargeable battery. I love that it is pretty quick when I push the button to take a picture. My last camera took forever and my subjects had to stand posed for far to long to be natural. So I'm VERY happy with that with this camera. It takes super clear photos that my friends were impressed with, even in low light. And interior shots came out just as crisp as exterior. While catching someone moving, it is fair to good depending on the level of movement. Sometimes you couldn't even tell (like talking, general head movement and walking), and on occasion there is a little blur (quick hand movements, running, falling). But then, you can't really expect to get fast moving pictures with a point and shoot, can you?

Reviews.Title: This is an exceptional camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: johnvenrick
Reviews.Content: The Elph 110 HS has cool creative shooting modes. It also has slow-sync flash. It is a lot of fun. I have been shooting photography since the 80's, the auto focus is the biggest problem on cameras under $500, this one has a pretty good auto focus, I was suprised. The color is awesome. The digital zoom is pretty clean and it fosuses ok digitally zoomed. I have had trouble with this on other cameras. The buttons are small though, thats going to be true on any camera this size I guess. I can tell you that this camera absolutely blows away my  Nikon L 120. I am very satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot review
Reviews.Author: tommiller
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to replace my Samsung camera that was dying because it was rated so highly. The powershot had several problems-  the zoom didn't focus and the camera crops pictures in large steps. I returned this item and ordered a new Samsung

Reviews.Title: Interface issues.
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Documentation weak on the camera and computer interface.  While easy to remove flash card to transfer pictures, I have not been able to cable transfer.

Reviews.Title: Didn't like it at first
Reviews.Author: Beatrice
Reviews.Content: I didn't like it at first but once I got used to it and took the opportunity to play with the settings more, I found that it really wasn't a bad camera (especially for the price that I purchased it for!)

Reviews.Title: upgrade to 1080p hd
Reviews.Author: J. David Bell
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from Powershot 5600 (720p hd) video capability to 1080p hd with this ELPH 110 HS.  I take a lot of videos and post to youtube.com and wanted the best video quality possible.  this camera also takes great pictures.  can't beat it for $119 shipped free.  i've been buying canon cameras every 2 to 3 years....not becuase they wear out but becuase technilogy keeps advancing quickly....amazing thing is each camera ends up costing $119...lets face it, no camera phone takes good pictures and videos like these babies.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera w/ Lots of Features
Reviews.Author: David Tanaka
Reviews.Content: Great camera with the latest DIGIC 5 image processor. Pictures and videos come out great. Extremely compact and well designed. I prefer this model compared to the touchscreen equivalent Canon PowerShot ELPH 320 HS because it's quicker to use and can be used in bright sunlight.Pros: very compact, DIGIC 5, wide angle lens (24mm), 5x bright zoom lens, 1080p HD video, 3" screen, 16.1 mp, super light & slim, Canon UA lens, lots of creative options, cool self timer options, face ID, Canon Optical Image Stabilization, High-Speed Burst mode at 5.8 frames per second, Super Slow Motion Movie mode, Highlights Reel with 720p Movie Digest mode, tactical controls, and looks and feels great.Cons: not as fast as some cameras. If you don't mind a little extra weight and size, the Canon PowerShot SX260 HS is a superior camera and well worth the slight extra cost. For super compacts this camera can't be beat.Overall, if you want a super compact camera with tons of features, easy to use and at a great price this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: puma
Reviews.Content: I recieved it quicker than expected. The camera looks great and takes beautiful pictures. For someone who doesn't take, taking picture too seriously it perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: This camera makes photos look so great! I love its auto selection of different types of settings and effects it should apply. A fantastic point and shoot type camera for high quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Lina
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to have a better camera because the one I had before was not that good. This camera has 16.1 MP and makes really good pictures. Eventough it was smaller than I thought it would be it is a good size and easy to handle. I can highly recommend this camera for the normal family life, etc.

Reviews.Title: Easy and exact
Reviews.Author: Dyan Espindle
Reviews.Content: Just needed something simple but effective and efficient this does the job. Small and easy to carry. Reccomend getting the EVA molded camera case in same color.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Kelsey Sullivan
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I needed an upgrade, and working in a daycare I have had a lot of experience with a variety of different cameras. I love love love the large display screen. Also, this item got delivered to my house before I even got a shipment notification! It was pretty awesome!

Reviews.Title: A GREAT QUALITY CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Janice H. "Janice"
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera, and I took a few photos with it and I love how it auto adjusts to the surrounding backgrounds! The only thing I have to say is that the circular navigation buttons (on the back) looks a little a bit out-dated for my taste. I also tried the video quality..it pretty good but the sound quality is a bit low. I love how this camera also comes in several colors which can suit anyone! Its also pretty small and compact which is perfect for traveling! Overall, its a pretty good camera and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Solid and small
Reviews.Author: William Kristoph
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS is a solid point and shoot camera. I took one star off because the circular navigation buttons on the back can be hard to use if you have large hands. Overall, it's a solid value with a lot of features and it takes great pictures. I'm quite happy.Pros:Crystal clear photosLarge display for taking great photosLots of presets to chooseSmall, but solidCons:The circular navigation buttons can be hard to use if you have large hands

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Kemp
Reviews.Content: I love the Canon ELPH camermas!  This is my third one in the last 10-12 years.  I still have my old cameras, but have purchased new ones just because of the upgrades and improvements.  Great to carry in your purse or pocket.  Great quality pictures! Easy to change settings!  Durable casing!  I love I'll enjoy this one as much as I have the others!

Reviews.Title: buy a great little camera
Reviews.Author: Annie  K.
Reviews.Content: This is such a great small camera with wonderful pictures.  It fits in my purse easily. I am pleased that it can take so many pictures on one battery charging. Plus everything you are going to need comes in the box.  No extra purchases therefore, are needed.  I had paid for it through a "used" Amazon site, "Ron's Good Stuff".  It arrived PROMPTLY (tho I checked the wrong time, in error) and I even had a note from Ron about camera care....it was a brand new never opened box...a good buy!

Reviews.Title: Nice & Easy
Reviews.Author: Kimberly J. Drane
Reviews.Content: I'm not hard to please - happy with all my pictures and ease of use so far. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: So glad I got this super point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: K. R. Smith
Reviews.Content: I have been getting Canon point and shoots for several years now. Unfortunately, my daughter recently broke the one I got last year, and I was using an older model as a temporary replacement, so I needed to invest in a new one sooner than I would have liked. Thankfully, this camera did not disappoint! I've only had it for a few days, but I am thrilled with the quality of the images so far. Inside or outside, it takes crisp, vibrant photos on the automatic setting, which is exactly what I wanted. It also takes great video. Some of the custom settings are really cool too, like the single color with black and white, the miniature effect, and the super slow motion video. I mostly take photos of my children, and for what I need it for (as an untrained but prolific photographer), this camera is perfect. So glad I got it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best cameras I've used. With 16.1 MP, it gives a very clear and crisp picture. The video recording is sharp. All the accessories it came with are fully functional. I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: clif
Reviews.Content: The camera is great.  There was a bit of a learning curve to adjust to the features.  The photo quality is excellent.  The compact size and simplicity are the strong points.  The large screen is a major plus.

Reviews.Title: It's almost perfect!
Reviews.Author: ann boughn vanlydegraf
Reviews.Content: I choose this rating because I think this product can be improved.  The picture quality is great but the shutter speed is too slow so action shots are hard to get.  I would also prefer the back to be a full screen instead of a partial screen like in the Sony comparable.  My final comment is that when trying to use the telephoto it moves so fast I can never get the telephoto position I want.  It is either too large or too small.

Reviews.Title: The palm sized replacement for a full sized SLR
Reviews.Author: Greg Mueller
Reviews.Content: This was bought for my mother who loves to traval to graduations, weddings, and performances of her grandchildren. She has a full sized Nikon with multiple lenses, but found it cumbersome, especially when traveling. She wanted the same quality of photo, but in a size she could put into a pocket, or purse. This small versatel camera has fulfilled that need, and has surpassed every expectation ... It is one fantastic camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: MMCL "Blue Cow"
Reviews.Content: I am really liking this camera. It takes great pictures without flash on the automatic mode! In general it is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Everything it stated is true
Reviews.Author: LJ
Reviews.Content: For the everyday person who just wants to take sharp clear photos of what ever this cannon powershot ELPH 110 HS camera delivers everything it claims.  The videos at 1080p are cool too.It is simple to use and rather intuitive.  For the money it is a great value.  Couldn't be happier and my wife loved the color.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: E. Diaz
Reviews.Content: Great camera for everyday photography.  I purchased this for a vacation I went on and it took great pictures in a variety of settings (mountains, beach, indoors, night, etc.).  The video function is also great.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera...
Reviews.Author: Jackie W. "JW"
Reviews.Content: Love this small camera. You can take it anywhere you want. It's a great point and shoot camera, it takes very clear pictures and videos. I have backgrounds in taking photo so I like to have a good camera. I own Nikon d5000 digital SLR and love it but can't take it anywhere since its too big.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!!
Reviews.Author: Ric
Reviews.Content: The clarity of the images is phenomenal! The camera is durable, easy to use and takes excellent photographs. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone!

Reviews.Title: First Canon I ever owned - WOW Nice!
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: I always read reviews before I purchase anything, so after finding the Canon PowerShot the Best in Review, I purchased one. I could not be more satisfied. The 16 MP format gives beautiful, sharp, and clear photos. It slips right in my pocket and its quick start-up and clear, bright screen are always ready for that photo moment. I also like the charging bay - no more wires and cables to carry and hook up. All the auto features are amazing for a camera this size. I also got one for my wife as she needed an upgrade as well. But, by far, I am "blown away" with the HD video. I take a lot of sports and moving videos. The stabilization technology is excellent. Even walking over rough ground while shooting, the camera stays steady and clear. Also, when shooting video the "zoom in" and "zoom out" are slowed which produces and much nicer overall film. Focus is good in video mode as well. I used to be a professional wedding photographer. I used medium format equipment to get that perfect photo but this little Canon would give the "Big Boys" a run for their money. I give it a 4.8+ for sure. Why not perfect? The battery does not last very long especially when shooting video. I'll probably order another battery to throw in my bag.

Reviews.Title: We got this as a backup camera..
Reviews.Author: R. Whitaker "The Rajah"
Reviews.Content: The excellent performance of this very small camera is finding a lot of use since it's a camera that's with us often, either in a jacket pocket or my wife's purse. There's an old saying that goes something like, "The best camera for the job is the one you actually have with you." At 16 Megapixels, this has the same resolution as our much larger DSLR, while recognizing that the small lens is somewhat of a compromise, it is surprisingly good. Most of the pictures we use it for are for newsletters and not for poster sized prints, so it's very often the right camera for the job since it's handy and unobtrusive. I may get a second one so my wife and I would each have one. It's an excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great pics from a little camera
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: Great little camera but with the small size comes little buttons.  Some buttons not as intuitive as I would wish but does the job and takes great pics with and without the flash.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Buys Quality "shop amazon for everything"
Reviews.Content: I had an Olympus that I never did really like.  There was a bright spot that showed up on all the images.  I asked my friends on FB what kind of camera they would buy--99% said a Canon.  I chose this camera for its simplicity but it takes a great picture.  And...if I really want to I can make some adjustments.  Frankly though, the auto everything option works extremely well.  I got a big fat 16 GB card for taking videos and it never gets full.

Reviews.Title: The best for size and HD video
Reviews.Author: JediMind
Reviews.Content: There are better true resolution cameras out there but the HD video on this camera is astonishing...CONS:-only 9.7MP true resolution-seems to be made too light causing it to possibly break easy-slow motion setting is not HD-no GPS-no 3DPROS:-1080p recording-nice 24mm wide lens- cool 5x zoom-nice 3' LCD-nice pics-very thin (smaller than iPhones)-good batty life (170 shots)- user friendly (buttons, settings, etc.)-price $172 (green)This camera is worth $170 bucks. The trade offs with other high end cameras is that it does 1080p recording and takes awesome pics for public use. Overall, this rating is based on someone who does not know much about photography and likes to pull out a camera from his pocket and shoot. I like this camera a lot. I will not return it as I planned because of its features.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, great picture quality
Reviews.Author: C. Molis
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazingly good, no great, photos.  It's easy to use, has many settings for different effects, etc, if you want to do that in your photos.  It also has 'manual settings', so if you know how you want to change the settings, you can do that, similar to a lower-to mid level DSLR style camera. It also fits nicely in your pants pocket, since it is quite thin.  All in all, it is a fantastic camera. Would very much recommend it.

Reviews.Title: very impressive
Reviews.Author: trini boi
Reviews.Content: Bought this for someone so & they were very pleased. Even I was surprised when I finally go my hands on it & took some pictures. Quality was excellent, design's sleek & beautiful & fit well in you hands. For the price it an excellent buy

Reviews.Title: Canon does it again
Reviews.Author: Novel Man
Reviews.Content: The new Canon ELPH point-and-shoot is much like the last ELPH point-and-shoot I had, only lots better on the inside. On the outside, the 110HS is marginally trimmer, and a lot cooler looking in all black, but the innards are what really make the difference. The auto function really shows the results that 5 years of gradual improvements have created where it counts most: in each superb photograph. The controls continue to be simple and innovative, and the automatic functions do as much thinking for you as you want. The options to go manual and turn off auto flash, tracking, et al are yours to access and enjoy, or ignore and go blissfully on your hi-tech photographic way. This is a great camera to pack in your bag for a weekend or a grand European tour. Either way, it is massively better than the smartphone camera default. Megapixels and Canon imaging technology win again.

Reviews.Title: I AGREE IT'S A FINE CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: fsh4den
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to replace an old tried and true Olympus Stylus 300 that I used for my real estate business.Checked all the consumer reviews and decided on the Canon ELPH HS 110 due to its low light capabilities and large LCD screen.  While I am not a camera buff and will more than likely not use even a quarter of the features, I was  duly impressed by the clarity of the LCD screen and the ease of using the HD video.  As a guy with large hands the only down side for me is the rather small size of the camera which makes it difficult to hold.  I did find, however, that the use of the hand strap helped tremendously!  Probably the best feature for me will be the timer and tripod socket for taking photos of my really BIG FISH when no one is around! lol

Reviews.Title: Tripster Canon Powershot WLPH 110
Reviews.Author: cookie
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were planning a trip to Niagara Falls for our anniversary. We wanted a camera that was easy to carry and dependable. We researched online and found two models we liked and had good reviews. We did not want to blow our budget on a camera. We chose the Canon Powershot ELPH 110. We ordered it online and it arrived in less then 5 days. We read instructions which were very simple to follow. We took a few trials photo before leaving on our trip. I was amazed at the clarity of our pictures.We took great wide angle pictures of the Niagara Falls, plus while we were moving on our tour bus the pictures were not blurry but very clear. We have some great pictures at night as well.The camera is small enough to carry in your shirt pocket or in a purse. It is very functional for all our picture taken.We took video pictures while riding on the Maid of the Mist boat. They more very clear along with good audio. I feel this is a great little camera that suits all our needs. Very easy to use, very light weight, good clarity. We purchased a memory card and a camera case at the time we ordered.

Reviews.Title: Excellent image quality for the price; buttons somewhat difficult to press.
Reviews.Author: ACC3D
Reviews.Content: The Elph 110 takes far better photos than my higher-end Elph SD780 from 3 years ago. I'm especially impressed with the speed and low light performance. The main control buttons next to the screen are difficult to push and don't have much tactile feedback though.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Marie Walsh
Reviews.Content: This product works well for what I bought it for.  The item shipped in a timely fashion.  The camera needs time to take the picture, there is a delay before a shot is taken.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Metzger
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera today, so I've only taken a handful of photos with it. So far I don't have any complaints. I have a DSLR so I know my way around a camera, but I wanted something small to carry everywhere so I don't have to lug my DSLR everywhere. I took a few low light shots and they have turned out well enough for a point and shoot.Pros:Picture quality is great for a point and shoot.There are a lot of menu settings that allow you to tweak photos and add different effects.It is small and lightweight.It is simple to use if you've owned other Canon point and shoots before. The menu systems are similar, etc.The tripod mount is near the middle, so the camera can be mounted on a small tripod without tipping one way.Cons:I've noticed that the flash is poorly placed. If you use the flash there's a small bit of the photo near the lower right corner that is dark because of the flash placement. If you use a wider angle than needed the dark spot can be cropped out.I haven't really tested the video yet other than viewing a video on camera. When I get time I'll make a video and load it on the computer to test the quality. There are plenty of test videos on YouTube that show the quality.So far this camera has performed above average as far as the other point and shoots I've owned. I have a Powershot Elph SD1000 that I bought about 5 years ago and my first digital Canon was the Powershot Elph SD100. I have been pleased with all of my Canon camera purchases. The SD100's shutter died on me after about 5 years and then I bought the SD1000. My SD1000 is still working, but I felt like I needed an upgrade. I would highly recommend this camera for someone looking to get a small camera to carry on a daily basis. I will update if I feel I have anything else to add to this review.Edit: I upgraded from 4 to 5 stars because I found that you can change the ISO if you choose program mode. So the only fault I have found with the camera is the flash issue. I would recommend purchasing a 16g class 10 SD card if you want to take video. Right now I have an 8g Class 6 SD card, it works well enough, but I may find myself in a situation where I want to take some video and photos and need more room.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: nicoleondynamite
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! A family member of mine bought it and I really liked it, but didn't like the price tag. So, I went to my favorite site, AMAZON.COM, and found it for $50 cheaper than my brother spent at Best Buy! This is definitely a great buy!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mom of 2
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. It takes great, crisp pictures. I purchased this camera to replace a Canon that broke when dropped. This is sleek and can fit into a pocket easily. I love the color blue, it really pops! I use this for video as well as pictures and the videos are great too! I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Loves Photos & More!
Reviews.Author: Michelle M "Michelle"
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best smaller cameras I have ever used and now owned. My sister had bought one and I loved it. I have a slight addiction to cameras and own about 15 now. This is by far my favorite right now. From the color of it, the ease of carrying it in a small handbag or my pocket to all the features it has. The photos come our beautifully. Definitely worth the money. I am not a photographer but feel like one when I use this. Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: Almost great but not quite
Reviews.Author: Jean P. Martin
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this camera. It's small, lightweight, great in low light and it comes in the light pink color that I like. It also has a fast shutter speed and the picture quality is so clear and sharp. The best picture quality I've ever seen in a point and shoot. However, the sound when zooming in during video is noticeable. Also, there is a big brown curved shadow at the bottom right hand corner when using the flash. I called Canon and they said this is a known issue because the flash is close to the lens. I've seen this happen in other cameras but not to this extent. The shadow is very big and noticeable. Lastly, the pictures come out very noticeably warped/stretched on the sides. People on the sides look like they've been stretched by one of those carnival mirrors. So I'm sad to say that I'm returning this camera (after trying two of them out). My search for a good point and shoot continues. It seems like newer cameras are not as good as the old ones (most of which have been damaged and I really also just want another camera as a backup). I've tried different brands at different price points and I'm still not happy with anything.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Ocean
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time and money on this camera, despite the good reviews! After buying a Canon PowerShot Elph 300 for my husband several months ago, this newer Canon is a huge disappointment. We have been extremely impressed with the Elph 300, and I wanted a slim, great performing camera for a little less money. Too bad the Elph 110 is as cheap as it looks and feels. It is very noisy during photo shooting, as well as the flash itself, and the camera is extremely slow rebounding for the next frame. It would not be possible to shoot a series of frames with this camera, it's just too slow! The zoom quality is equally disappointing, because the image on the screen is so grainy and blurry that I wouldn't trust the camera to actually take good pictures. Unfortunately, I had to send it back, it simply was not worth keeping.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: A Dalek
Reviews.Content: This camera does not produce impressive images.  A point and shoot should be able to deal with a range of basic indoor conditions, such as taking a picture of a group of people in a restaurant under artificial light.  This was attempted.  The settings used were the factory default.  The camera failed the test.  The images are dim and often have a yellow hue.  The effect of the flash is unpredictable and generally unhelpful.  An Apple iPhone took better images each time.  Cameras can and do beat the Apple.  If you want bad indoor pictures of 16.1 mega pixels then buy this.  Otherwise, save your money and use your smartphone.  Or buy another camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon ELPH 110
Reviews.Author: RG
Reviews.Content: Light, easy to use and carry aroud. Takes good sharp pictures. I like the HD video feature and found it very clear even at night. Disadvantages are the zoom is not much and the battery dies fast if the video feature is used. Recommend 32GB SDHC card and a spare battery for video.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but a but puzzled
Reviews.Author: Grant M. Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for $199 Saturday August 3, and looked again the next day and the price had dropped by $30. Thankfully I was able to cancel the order and order the camera at the lower price. The camera is impressive for normal home use, but one thing really puzzles me and that is I bought the 16 gig memory card and found out that much memory will only give you 1 hour of HD movie recording, this is, no doubt, due to the .MOV format. Come on Cannon, you can do better than that, MPEG 4 as far as I can tell is free..I am very dissapointed as managing with this aspect as files this large eat up a large amount of memory not only on your camera but your computer as well.

Reviews.Title: Cannon dropped the ball with this one
Reviews.Author: ursasolus
Reviews.Content: I've had my Cannon ELPH 110 HS for two weeks now, and am very disappointed in the camera's over all function and quality.I had been using a Cannon PowerShot A3100 IS for the past two and a half years, and have put it through its paces to the point that I wanted to replace it with something newer. At first, the ELPH 110 HS looked comparable in quality and function; until I started using it in a variety of daily use situations.The performance from push of the button to actual photo taken is sluggish. Indoor, low light photos are often blurred; especially if someone so much as twitches before the flash. Even though this camera has a dedicated movie button, which is definitely a convenience, the movies are stored in .mov format which is like taking a step back to the early 2000's in video storage and transfer. Cannon needs to stick with .avi and .mpg formats like most of their other cameras.The poor battery life of this camera is inexcusable. My PowerShot 3100 IS camera could go for days of constant use, or weeks of casual use without needing charged. This camera burned through a full battery pack charge before my daughter's 3 hour birthday party was finished; and I had to switch to my 2 year old Droid X phone to finish taking photos. By the way, I got better over all photos from my 5.0 megapixel camera phone than I did the ELPH 110 HS.If all you plan to do is take photos and video in highly lit areas, where people are staged and not moving, this camera will get you by. If you plan on capturing photos of your kids and family playing, at their soccer or baseball game, or in un-staged situations; you're better off leaving this camera on the shelf.UPDATE: Less than a month after taking this camera out of the box, and having only taken about 100 pictures, I had to take it back. The camera lost the ability to auto focus when trying to zoom in on subjects. This model of camera is just too poorly designed and manufactured to suit even my most basic photography needs.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my aspiring Photographer
Reviews.Author: Gary P Turner
Reviews.Content: My daughter wanted a compact camera to carry with her all the time. She is in a Photography class so I wanted to get her one that was compact but also gave the user a lot of control over things like exposure and other adjustments. This camera so far has fit that bill. My daughter stated that even her teacher of the photography class was impressed by so much camera in a little package

Reviews.Title: couldn't utize all the feature
Reviews.Author: brick
Reviews.Content: The camera comes with a cd for instructions for use and many other  features that can be accessed only if you have a newer computer. Not available for imac osx 10.4.11. Would not have purchased this camera if they would have made it known the requirements needed to use all functions.

Reviews.Title: Small and good (mild tendency to overexpose)
Reviews.Author: MysticJaguar
Reviews.Content: Pretty much any camera without a viewfinder is useless in bright sunlight.  (Canon used to have very good A-series cameras with optical viewfinders but they cheapened out the A-series when they created the G and the SX lines.)  Yes, you can get a longer zoom like on Canon PowerShot SX260 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 20x Image Stabilized Zoom 25mm Wide-Angle Lens and 1080p Full-HD Video (Black) which is a very good travel cam.  But when you can't really see what's happening on the sunlit-washed LCD most other camera features are candy.I bought this camera to travel with for a trip this summer.  I also have a great micro 4/3rd camera with an electronic VIEWFINDER Panasonic DMC-G5KK 16 MP Compact System Camera with 14-42mm Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCD (Black) but I'm not packing that into the Amazon jungle.  The Elph 110 is my travel cam, small enough to fit into a Pelican waterproof case, and cheap enough that I won't cry is something happens to it.The camera features are pretty good.  This is pretty basic, no optical viewfinder, no shutter priority (Tv/S) or aperature priority (Av/A) modes.  You have limited but adequate settings for a tiny P&S.;  The color rendition is pretty good.  The camera is fairly well laid out.  Ergonomically though this model does not have a spinning mode dial like on the SX160 and other Canons.  This means moving through the menu system is SLOW.  The buttons are inlaid on the back body which is good making it unlikely you will hit them by accident.  But having them indented AND no spinning mode means you spend way too much time changing settings.  And the menu button itself is tiny.  With the word Menu below, not on the button, you may find yourself pressing in the wrong place.Based on images posted on the Internet before my purchase I was concerned about image sharpness.  If you go to the Canon website and look at the sample photo for this camera of the girl with red hair, you will have a very hard time finding out what is actually in focus and what is sharp.  That image on the Canon site is very fuzzy and not a great representation of what you can get with this camera.  From shots I've taken image sharpness is adequate but may vary based on individual unit within the same model.  My photos look fine but many of those from this model camera on flickr, amazon, and elsewhere on the Internet do not look that sharp.  There is a sharpness setting in my colors/custom that can boost the results.The largest IQ problem with this camera is that it tends to overexpose by 1/3 - 2/3 stop when used outdoors.  This might just be a problem with my copy but it does show up in a good percentage of photos.  Shooting outdoors would be the first thing I would check after getting this camera.  You can adjust through EV overrides and by trying out different scene modes.  But seriously this kind of problem should not be present in any modern P&S.;Summary:  If you want a small very pocketable P&S;, don't need a long zoom range, and can live without a viewfinder, this is one of the best picks at currently ~$150 as of this review.  If you want a longer zoom then Canon PowerShot SX160 IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 16x Wide-Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD (Black) or Canon PowerShot SX260 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 20x Image Stabilized Zoom 25mm Wide-Angle Lens and 1080p Full-HD Video (Black) would be the next steps up both in IQ, size, functions, and zoom.Competition:  I had looked at the Sony and Panasonic models and done alot of research online.  I spent some time with the Sony and Canon models at Target.  I use dpreview.com and the jpeg image comparison and go to center and all the corners of the photos to get an idea.  I also use imaging-resource.com and look at their images in detail.  Early on I thought I was going to get a Panasonic as all my other cameras are Panasonic.  But I don't care for the latest Panasonic menus and some very hit and miss IQ and handling across the lower end of their line these days.  I like Sony menu's better but don't care for Sony ergonomics.  In P&S; I think Canon is currently doing the best job in providing a variety of good models.  And Canon's IQ on the lower end has really improved in the past few years.  (One exception is the Elph 300 which has very poor corner sharpness, almost increadibly bad).

Reviews.Title: Love the features, hate the problems
Reviews.Author: Julie K
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, unfortunately it keeps coming up with 'lens error, camera shuts down automatically'. Because its under warranty, canon has replaced it, great for them, but at this point, I'm on the 5th camera in a year, 3 since August. Obviously a huge defect but they won't refund, just replace. Hate to switch because I do love the settings, quality of pictures, and features, but i use the camera for school and family and can't risk being without it. Lens error excluded, this has been my favorite camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Casual User Camera
Reviews.Author: Rusty57
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a 5 year old Canon digital camera.  This camera is excellent and meets all my needs.  I was surprised at the automatic features that focus on distant objects when zooming.  I have solar film on some windows that caused problems with the older camera.  Between the camera features and the included software, I am now able to take photos through the film and get OK pictures of the animals passing through the yard.  The larger camera screen also makes it a lot easier to see the target with my older eyes.

Reviews.Title: Really nice and awesome camera. super fast picture taking. sharp pics.
Reviews.Author: mishka
Reviews.Content: i love this camera. i feel like a professional when taking pictures. takes awesome sharp high quality pics. and if you hold the snap button it takes pictures none stop fast. everyone likes my camera. today at the lake we had baptsim and there was many people taking pictures with all the camera.s and people said my camera stood out the most out with the most nice sharp pics.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH110
Reviews.Author: sue
Reviews.Content: I love the new Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 camera I purchased on Amaazon. It takes a lovely picture and is so easy to use. The large lens is so easy to see what you are taking a picture of. I would recommend this camera to those who want an inexpensive easy to use camera.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: coco123
Reviews.Content: i made a very good purchase when i bought this camera!! i love it although it is not a DSLR it is a very good quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Santa's Elvis
Reviews.Content: Lightweight, durable, easy to use.  I got mine in a bright color so I don't lose it.  It's the size and weight of a cell phone and takes perfect pictures and video.  The zoom is quick and even.  The screen is bright and big for how tiny the camera is.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: Sharon Delury
Reviews.Content: Higher than expected guality in such a small camera. Easy to use right out of the box. No manual is the only problem. I don't like to have to go on line to learn how to use all it's features. Pictures are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: JRae
Reviews.Content: Love this small, fantastic camera! It has great color and takes great pictures. Perfect if you're wanting a good, small camera, for a good price!

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy N.
Reviews.Content: I had researched cameras because I wanted to do youtube videos of myself performing songs and playing guitar. This one was recommended. It is High Def 1920 and the videos came out awesome. When using my own mic and sound system to perform my music the sound came out great. Thanks Cannon.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Dominique Andre "Dominique Andre"
Reviews.Content: i go everywhere with it specially on my UTV rides... i get great picturesi love this camera...for the price it comes with cool features and awesome quality pics...Love it

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Richard M. Landers
Reviews.Content: Really a quality camera.  Super pictures and handles abuse well.  My wife uses it out on the trail and in mud getting pics of the kids.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Adriele C.
Reviews.Content: As advertised! Great Camera. I haven't had the chance to try the video feature yet, but I have played with the camera and it is amazing. Such a great deal on the price too! Very excited to use this!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Melissa McLoed
Reviews.Content: This camera takes awesome pictures! It was a good deal for the price. I would recommend this to normal people (not photographers) who want really nice looking pictures that are easy to take.

Reviews.Title: It takes great pictures.... sometimes.
Reviews.Author: auger8
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th cannon powershot. Seems to take a much longer time to focus than any of the previous models we had.When taking HD movies, it seems fall in and out of focus for no reason.It takes great night and low light shots though.It was dropped hard and quit working soon after we got it, but was able to get it working again with a combination of pliers, hammer, and luck. It has been working fine now for the past 6 months.

Reviews.Title: Good stuff
Reviews.Author: Robert R.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife. She was a previous owner of and older model elph. What a easy to use point and use camera.

Reviews.Title: used camera but looks like new
Reviews.Author: Dang D.
Reviews.Content: I lost my camera, I was happy to find an used one, and I have no complaint about my camera. It works well and looks like new :) .

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: The Canon ELPH series constitutes light-weight, fun cameras, available in many colors, and focused on convenience. Let me use my usual disclaimer, in the interest of fairness, and admit that many cameras by reputable makers (and there are many) deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and get the whole picture.The ELPH110 is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 16.1 resolution (megapixels), and a x5 zoom. The sensor size is 1/2.3 inch CCD-type, which is standard for cameras of its class.If you were to, say, take pictures of friends and family at an outdoor gathering, this camera is what you need. If you get ambitious, there will be stumbling blocks. Here is the camera's trait mix: It does not have a viewfinder, which, again, many in its class don't. The ISO rating, which is the gauge for how well it does in low light, is 3200. That rating is lower than many others, but it is sufficient for most purposes. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. It does not have a hot shoe for an external flash option. That is not unexpected for its size and category. The LCD screen is a 461,000 resolution. The camera does not do RAW processing but you would need only if you did not want to be limited by JPEG type storage. The burst rate is a fast 5.8- great for quick shots. The weight of the camera is a convenient 133 grams.Overall, nice, fun camera. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Douglas Field
Reviews.Content: This camera is great in that it is lightweight and super compact. It takes excellent quality photos and videos in 1080p. Its style and color are perfect and the camera has a 5 optical zoom which comes in handy while takeing pictures. This was a gift for someone else and they loved it.

Reviews.Title: elph 110
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Poirier "Music King"
Reviews.Content: love it . great little camera with all the features one would need. This is my second one as I destroyed the first

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot ELPH 110 Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Donald H. DiLoreto
Reviews.Content: The product arrived on time, well packed, went into action shortly there after and has been operating very well since purchase.I would recommend this camera to any amateur or professional photographer.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Donald V. Beckwith "DONGOLF101"
Reviews.Content: Very excellent camera well worth the money very nice size and takes great pictures great size and fits wellDon

Reviews.Title: Super awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: This camera has not let us down since the day we got it. It takes incredible quality pictures and its sleek and slim design makes it easy to pack around for events or travelling. For years my husband insisted on packing around his huge and time consuming (changing lens) DSLR camera. Because of the great picture quality this camera takes.. He hasn't used his professional camera in over a year..

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot pocket camera
Reviews.Author: T.R. Norman
Reviews.Content: I always seem to come back to Canon, and probably always will when it comes to small pocket cameras. Don't let this cameras small size and mostly full auto features keep you away, the image quality, especially in natural light, is quite impressive. This is a great camera to throw in your pocket and have at the ready any time you want to snap a quick picture, with quality that will far surpass your average smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Russell Stevens
Reviews.Content: I had a Samsung and I like the shutter speed and style of this camera much more. was also relatively affordable

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Borocay
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good pictures for a point and shoot camera.  I sold the first one I owned and missed it so much that I bought another one.  It is the perfect camera to put in your purse and pocket to take pictures on a moments notice.  It also takes 1080p video.  It is a shame that Canon discontinued this model since its successor only has 720p video.  Buy one if you can find it at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Danny Winterfeld
Reviews.Content: I bought it on a sale and it's great. Works very well and is extremely handy. Not expensive and produces great quality pictures. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best! The picture quality is great. I love how tiny it is. I loved it so much I bought myself one and my mom one!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING cam for great price omg
Reviews.Author: MIz Valeer
Reviews.Content: So I was lookibg to spend about a hundred bucks on a new digi cam.  I had decided to go to 14 mp so long as it couod do 720 p ajd had a pretty good macro mode.What I found was THIS lovely camera at almost half off (originally over two hundred).  It has a BUNCH of great shooting modes and a super intuitiive + intelligent auto mode if you don't feel like customizing the shootong mode yourself.It has a GREAT macro setting, and it has 1080p, widescreen video.  This takes my vlogs and product reviews to a whole new professional, movie-quality level.Awesome handcam, as all my previous Canon Poewershots jave been. <3

Reviews.Title: Great little "extra" camera
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I bought this just to capture moments when I don't have my "big" camera with me.  I am a professional photographer, but sometimes lugging around my 7d is just too much, even though it is going to get me the best shot.  I found that I wasn't capturing my families shots, so this camera is a nice little one for that.  There are no manual modes, but it shoots very well in low light and that is most important to me!  :)  I prefer natural light to flash!

Reviews.Title: Indispensable first rate portable camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I like this camera so much that I have bought three of them (and half a dozen other powershot models).  I had the 12MP model, then upgraded to the 16MP version.  When that camera was stolen, I bought the same camera as a replacement.  I have marveled and impressed others at the ability of this camera to take sharp photos in low light situations.  The photos are comparable to the Nikon DSLR that I also use.  I have often used the movie digest feature when on vacation to record movies consisting of short clips recorded at the time that each photo is taken.  I also like the fact that in addition to its automatic modes, you can manually turn the flash on or off so that it can be used as a fill flash outdoors.  This camera stands out from all the other copies of pocket cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: Theresa Christen
Reviews.Content: Was a Christmas gift for my adult son. He really likes the size vs. a larger older model.. He uses it on his over-the-road trucking excursions. Takes good quality photographs for an average amateur.

Reviews.Title: This camera will blow your mind
Reviews.Author: Lab Tech Mom
Reviews.Content: Look there is a lot of snapshot cameras on the market.  This showed up in consumer reports as a best buy.  There is so much more to the story..  When I bought this camera it costed me 100.00$  This camera has a digic 5 chip in it for the image processing.  The same as the pro cameras.  As far as I can tell I think canon has stopped making these.  And stopped putting the digic 5 into thier snapshot camera.  Now this camera is selling for 200$ new if you can find it.  It is just one of those little gems.  The only thing I didn't like was it does have a bit of a slow shutter speed.  Other than that you can even do Long Exposures. It has all the features of a DSL if you know how to work it.  You can do upto 15 second shutter photo.  This little guy fits in your pocket very easy and seems to work in all situations.  Low light has been a bit of a problem for me, but not to bad all around.  I brag about this camera after I show people photos I have taken with it.

Reviews.Title: love
Reviews.Author: Dennis Lindoerfer
Reviews.Content: This camera.  It is so small and light, yet it has so many features.  I have a larger compact cannon, but always take and use this one

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: DEJIA
Reviews.Content: This item is wounderful to use. The pictures are great. Already have use this item great price and ,lots of fun

Reviews.Title: wanted a small camera
Reviews.Author: Bisko
Reviews.Content: My daughter  wanted a small camera, she could carry around and take pictures and videos with.  I have pretty-much always been a fan for Canon Products.  Setting it up for her and playing with it a bit, I was impressed a lot of it's features.  Excellent wide angle coverage and big viewing screen on back.  I have the new 5Ti and vanity aside, this ELPH would be as good for most of my picture taking excursions.  Dragging the bulky bigger Canon can discourage outtings where a camera should be in attendance.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kris Cochran
Reviews.Content: Great camera, I have no complaints, very easy to use, takes quite good pictures for a small camera! Good Buy

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Rachel Kelly "des847"
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I decided to buy this one.  I had looked at several small cameras, and finally decided this one has all the features I want and it's very easy to use.  The quality of my photos is just amazing!  I'd recommend this one to any one interested in taking great quality photos with a very small, compact and easy to transport camera.  Great buy!

Reviews.Title: No blurring, Great quality. Trouble editing Video in Avidemux.
Reviews.Author: L. Hershberger "Self-Employed Artist/ Musicia...
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I had 3 digital Kodaks, one Sony (over $300 and no good for my needs) and now this is my 4th Canon. Such a good product for my needs.I have a lot of different needs that I expect out of my camera:1. Photos of knitting... up close, detail shots for the web and for print.2. Stills of dancers and musicians (extreme lighting and moving targets3. Video of people on stage, dancers & musicians4. Video for my art/knitting business... up close instruction videos of my hands, and video of my face (like a video podcast).The up sides:1. Regular USB connector and SD card, can be connected with normal non-proprietary methods to most laptops/computers.2.
