Reviews.Content: I actually chose this camera because of its ratings on Consumer Reports.  It is easy to use, compact, inexpensive, and takes great pictures.  The lime green color wasn't my first choice but, for some reason, it was cheaper than the other colors so that's what I went with.  Ironically, every time I use it people comment favorably on the color.  I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: VJM
Reviews.Content: So far so good, the pictures are very clear.  I'd give it a 5 but the instructions in the manual is bad and I've had to figure out a lot by my self.  I'm too old to be using trial & error to figure things out.  Shutter speed could be better.But love the pics.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: JOHN NNADI
Reviews.Content: This camera rocks, cute, apt and just good enough for the amateur photographer. Just wish it was touch screen, so my nephew can have a blast looking at his photos. Happy buy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: Arrived quickly! takes great photos, has a variety of setting and features. I would recommend this to anyone as it is easy to use and navigate.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: aulie
Reviews.Content: Okay. There were 3 factors why I got this camera!)  It's a canon ( what can go wrong with a canon? )2)  It's green ! ( for a change )3)  The reviews were okay :)My last camera was an ixus and all along, i though I was getting an ixus ( totally my fault. was too excited to get a camera that i wasnt able to double check :(Tried taking photos with it and loved the outcome. But I guess I sort of miss ixus' camera setting and knobs. The camera's really slim and compact so i guess it serves its purpose of being a handy point and shoot camera.The only thing that made me sad was tha price :( I got it for 179 ( plus tax ) and upon checking it again , it dropped to 129! :( I wish i hadnt bought one so soon :( boohoohoo. They say not to cry over spilled milk but I cant help it. looking back I realized that it probably wasnt worth it because of the 179 price tag.If youre buying this for 129 then you surely have a good deal :) so wait until the price drops to around 129 before buying it.It comes with a nice strap :Dif only I can turn back time and buy this camera at a much cheaper price.lol

Reviews.Title: Great size, great price and wonderful pictures.
Reviews.Author: Keith Colwell
Reviews.Content: I use the camera a lot for taking eBay pictures for my ads. The close up image sharpness is just A+. Great size as the camera is very compact. The various features are easy to use once you go through the process a few times. A plus--- when you go to the menu to set up or change the features there is a short text message to help you.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use.
Reviews.Author: SacredCultivator
Reviews.Content: I'm definitely not one to say how good/bad something is since I'm not a techy and always ask a friend or two when it comes to purchasing any sort of technology.So a friend recommended this when I was looking at other products way out of my budget.I can't say that I'm disappointed with this at all, far from it. I love the design of it and how easy it is to use.I generally just have it set at Auto for most situations unless I find it not providing the results I want, then I go into Program to mess around with things.No way do I know what I'm doing when it comes to changing the settings.It's compact size is a bonus, as I prefer these point-and-shoots than the DSLR's. Since I'm not a photo-junky these do what I need them to and I leave the DSLR's to those that know how to use them to their full potential.The quality of the pictures when provided the right situations/settings are great and to my eyes I love the quality.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Bryant Kettle "Bryant"
Reviews.Content: I just used this camera extensively on vacation.  The functions are great and useful, the pictures and movies turned out great as well.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot.
Reviews.Author: Punchm
Reviews.Content: Bought as an early christmas gift. Great quality pictures in all environments. I would have given 5 stars but i was not impressed by the software on the camera itself. Best camera in this price range by far. The zoom is an actual lense zoom where as most lower priced cameras cut out pixels and image quality.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Roger Or Shelly Quail "jon"
Reviews.Content: Fast shipping and if the camera takes pictures as beautiful as the camera is itself I would say it rates above a 5 star.  We bought this for our grandaughter for Christmas so we will see in about a month.

Reviews.Title: Forced Flash
Reviews.Author: Nancy P Elliott
Reviews.Content: A forced flash is a must for me. This camera does not have that therefore many of my pictures have black faces (sun behind). Also battery needs charging too often. (Imagine if it had forced flash).I also have not been able to download manual to computer and hardcopy manual did not come w/ it. So far quality of pix seems good. Had canon, then Nikon then chose to come back to Canon. Would go back to Nikon for forced flash.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for starters
Reviews.Author: Ravi
Reviews.Content: Good camera for starters with amazing features like recording which makes life easier need not carry a camera and a handycam

Reviews.Title: Compact and well equipped
Reviews.Author: stan smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my wife, who was looking for a well equippedPoint and shoot, without having to read a NASA manual to understandThe features this camera offers. So far, it has lived up to the past reviewsI read on this model.

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot camera!!
Reviews.Author: stephen  w. wessels
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera, easy to slip into a cargo pocket of my hiking pants and the battery holds up well. The picture quality is excellent..

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the Elph 110HS
Reviews.Author: Jimmy "/jimmy/"
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera just prior to a three week European trip.  Installed a nothing fancy $6 8-gig class 10 SD card which appears to have a capacity of ~ 1,500 snaps.  Very pleased with the small size and weight which made it easy to carry around on long walks.  Picture quality extremely sharp.  Colors very good.  Not a pro camera by any means -- and low light performance is OK but not as good as what could be had with a larger and more expensive rig -- but overall, a brilliant compromise for the small size and light weight.  During my three week trip, took ~ 1k shots.  All easily downloaded to my MacBook using the provided cable and iPhoto.  Highly recommended for what it is.  And at the $129 price point with free shipping, a huge bargain!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera, It's everything I was hoping to get.  Great price, nice pictures too.  Only con I have about it is the sound is not loud enough on the videos.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: lucky dog
Reviews.Content: A birthday gift for my hubby, so he could take pictures and video during the Moab Trail Marathon.  The picture and video quality are fantastic, and the camera is small enough to tuck in a pocket.  It's easy to carry and operate while in motion and the stability feature is the bomb!After seeing the photos and video from our trip, my Dad was so impressed he ordered one.  :-)

Reviews.Title: Great camera, small size
Reviews.Author: Dean McCallum
Reviews.Content: Wife loves this camera.  Small, fits in her purse, yet takes really good photos.  If it can keep my wife happy, it's got to be good!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 110
Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. The size freaked me out at first since I used to own a photography business, but now that I have seen what it can do I am so happy I bought it! The picture quality is amazing and the fact that I can take videos while carrying it around in my pocket makes me smile.

Reviews.Title: For the money and size, nice camera.
Reviews.Author: PatJ
Reviews.Content: I bought one for my daughter earlier in the year and am thinking of getting one for my son.I broke it in during a full day at an amusement park and it worked out great.I have large hands, and of course, the finish is slick, but it felt comfortable.Mind you, it still isn't going to freeze active kids indoors without flash.For the money, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: I asked my son for the easiest camera to use.  He recommended the Canon Elph and he was so right.  I love the way it does most of my thinking for me and all I have to do is shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Beltran
Reviews.Content: I bought this one for my sister after doing a lot of research among point and shoot cameras around $150-$200 and she said:I am very happy with my Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS so far. The camera is quite light, and the screen is big, its fairly easy to use and it allows to change programs fast.Quality of image is very good both in colors and details... and I love it that is pink!!!Battery lasts up to 2 days using it often which I am very happy about. This was the reason I changed cameras, since my previous one (with batteries) did not cover more than a few hours.What I miss more are some functions, like trimming and the timer that are not easily accessible in Canon and I used to use them a lot on my old Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have ever had
Reviews.Author: Ahmed Abdul Moniem
Reviews.Content: Simply, Best camera I have ever had!Don't hesitate to buy this fine camera.It is so suitable and more than enough to the personal/home use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: dgreen1069
Reviews.Content: This is my third canon point and shoot camera. I still have the first, but the second died of the dreaded lens error. Apparently, Canon's are notorious for having that problem. Other than that, it's very portable and takes great photos. I looked at several competing cameras, but my wife loves the Canon.

Reviews.Title: Exelent white balance
Reviews.Author: Jaden P
Reviews.Content: Point and shoot camera... What i want from these cameras.1. AWB : auto white balance must be accurate.2. Fast AF : AF is very important3. 24mm wide : Yes, better than 28mm absolutley. Most of time i used this at 28 or 35 range but it dosen't mean no need 24mm. And f2.74. Makro is greatCons?1. No ISO option with black and white mode2. Not great iQ on 24mm3. Hard to push menu buttons on backside4. Need just one more some short cut button or customized ButtonOverall, good digital camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: GREAT little camera!
Reviews.Author: lm
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter's birthday.  We used it before we had a chance to read the instructions, but had no problem with the auto setting for all our shots.  It is an amazing little camera!  The pictures were quite good even in low light situations. My daughter kept making the comment, "This camera is amazing!"  The shots were crystal clear and made everyone look quite good.  The stabilization works great.  The camera worked equally well on landscapes and night time photos of Times Square.  I couldn't be happier with this purchase and neither could my 26-year-old daughter!  The lime green color is too cute!!  I would recommend it without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: Jacko
Reviews.Author: Jacko
Reviews.Content: Great camera for clear HD shots. I like the slow-motion effect and the 1-button movie. The clear close-ups and soft focus portrait shots add to the enjoyment of this newer Canon camera.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever!
Reviews.Author: M Miller
Reviews.Content: GREAT Camera - love it. Had an older version and just wore it out. Would recommend it to anyone that needs great pictures with a simple camera.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: JScott
Reviews.Content: Best camera for the price. Love this purchase. Wish I would've had this camera for the entire first year of my sons life.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST CHOICE!!
Reviews.Author: postandsell
Reviews.Content: I spent days and days researching point and shoot cameras. I wanted to take the best one I could I find, at a decent price to Italy. I bought one-- tried it at home, returned it. This Canon is AMAZING. The best picture quality you will find! Everything was great about it-- never had any issues. Even taking photos from the fast moving train came out clear and perfectly proportioned! Lighting, movement, zoom, video, focus--- the whole thing, its all in here. BEST PURCHASE FOR A CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: DARLAJEAN
Reviews.Content: I love Cannon products and this is one of them. The camera takes sharp pictures with vibrant color and is easy to use. The battery life is better than I'd hoped for having taken about 65 pics and two videos and the battery is at 70% strength.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 - Dandy Camera
Reviews.Author: lmrson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a "Pocket Camera".  It's perfect.  I usually shoot a Canon 60D, and that's bit of a load with lenses, flashes, batteries, you know?  When traveling I think there will be days that the ELPH will be the perfect choice.  Good for parties and such as well.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS - Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Oleg
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera, and i received it and i'm very pleased  with it. IT extra thin and extra weighted, more than i expected, but it does a really good job. For me, as a beginner photographer, it's great and it very cheap. Also it came well packed and i was very excited with the picture quality. It really does a decent job, and it's great for all types of photos: landscapes, portraits and moving objects. I'll have many chances to capture all i want with this superb camera.Also i want to mention the quantity of available options of shooting modes, that really excites me, so i want to try them all, and to make my own collection of photos. Best regards to Amazon.com, so they did a good job, and also to Canon, that doesn't disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: wlee
Reviews.Content: The best part about this product is its 24mm wide angle.  Probably one of the most accurate exposure P&S; I've used. Decent(not perfect) flash photo indoor... better flash quality than most P&S; I've used/tested. Only two complaints... 1) Shutter lags a bit (extra 3 to 5 seconds or so and that is a bit long) to use flash back to back, and 2) the price at $229 is a bit steep compared to other competitor models (<$200) but I am happy with the extra I paid for the wide angle and Canon built quality.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: J. Stutzman "Financial Analyst"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to finally own a Canon!Like* Portable* Decent evening pics (hold still!!)* Good VideoDis-like..*  Many of the pictures are fuzzy*  Battery Life is poorSo if you have 2 of the above problems, why buy a camera that won't work very long and 50% of the pics are fuzzy?I have an old DSC-50 Sony 2.2 mega pixal Cybershot camera.  This thing rarely if ever got a bad picture.  So I guess what I would say at this point is that I guess the bigger less portable lens must be the way to go.  Our second sony that we got after my cyber shot fell in the pool wasn't that great either.Lesson learned, don't go for portability if this is your only camera.  Move on.I can't give this less then 3 stars b/c I still love Canon.  Perhaps it's like being in love with a movie star that treats you like crap...It could just be a status thing.

Reviews.Title: poor choice
Reviews.Author: hgb
Reviews.Content: Received the camera and found it easy to set up and understand the controls.  Much better controls than on my older $100 A 460 canon . But when comparing the pictures of the two cameras I was really disappointed with the new 110 canon.  Most all pictures were not crisp and clear especially all taken over 10 feet.  The pictures on the older A 460 were much sharper both in close up and in distant shots.Flash pictures in the house were also a disappointment.  Colors were really off.  Outside light from a window really dramatically effected the whole picture.  Dark areas were too dark and light areas were too over exposed.  Flash pictures with the A 460 much more true.Battery lasted only about 6 to 8 hours with the 110.  My A 460  camera using two rechargeable AA batteries and lasts much much longer but also makes the camera larger and heavier.I did like the size of the camera as I could slip it into my pocket when not in use and I also liked the placement of the controls.  It has a large screen for viewing pictures before and after taking a picture but probably uses a lot of the battery charge.  My A460 display can be turned off as it also has a peep hole for taking pictures.  I only used the video part of the camera a few times and it seemed to work well.  However, I only bought the camera for taking still pictures.I have returned the camera , the case and all the extra batteries I also bought.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE REPLACEMENT FOR A GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Plain & Simple
Reviews.Content: Having been thoroughly impressed with Canon's Power Shot Elph 1100HS I thought this would be the logical replacement after losing my tried & true on a trip.  Let's cover some territory first -- this is NOT a professional DSLR that would be used for a photo shoot for the cover of Vogue magazine.  This is a 'point & shoot' camera designed for convenience & good picture quality, especially in the hands of someone who knows how to make the best of lighting.Having said that, I wish I would have bought another older 1100HS.  I purchased this one b/c of the reviews & the mistake I made was thinking it would be a modern day version of the older one.  Boy was that a mistake!!  I absolutely despise this camera!!  In a nutshell:-The battery life is bad-Scrolling around is difficult because of the design of the 'cursor wheel'-VIDEO MODE IS HORRIBLE!!!  THE CAMERA KEEPS TRYING TO AUTO FOCUS WHENEVER THE IT IS POINTED AT A DIFFERENT SUBJECT RENDERING THE ENTIRE VIDEO BLURRY & OUT OF FOCUS!!!  Sure it might be 1080p but who cares if it is 10 million 'P' if the whole video is out of focus??-Another thing about 1080p -- when the camera is set in that mode, you might get 2.5 - 3 minutes of video on a 2 Gig card.  Forget using SDHC cards b/c the video format will be unreadable... I found out the hard way!  Precious memories that were attempted to be captured with this camera on video have been lost to "video error-dom"!-The battery does not fit in other Canon Elph chargers.  This is more of a trivial point but I was hoping to be able to use the charger from my old Canon Elph to charge the battery for this camera simply for the sake of convenience but the size of the battery is different & the battery contact points are in a different location....therefore the battery/charger is not backwards compatible.. two thumbs down!!!If you are considering purchasing a compact camera for photo & some video use, look elsewhere & DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PIECE OF GARBAGE!!!

Reviews.Title: Mostly good with some complaints
Reviews.Author: David F. Wald
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Galapagos with it and used it with and without the Canon 10 ft underwater case. The size is awesome for the pocket.  Takes great pics in good light and pretty good shots in dimmer light.  Worked very well in the underwater case once you grease up the O-ring.  Things I didn't like:1. The videos I took underwater were noisy in that every time you zoomed you heard the sound of the zoom which took away from watching the video.  If only they had gotten rid of that sound pickup!2. The flash is a bit too close to the top of the camera so it's easy to partially block it when holding it. I had to tell others using it to take a picture of us to not block the flash.3. In Underwater mode, Auto ISO jumps to very high ISO numbers which keep the shutter speed high.  This did enable me to capture many moving shots of fish and sea lions but they ended up quite grainy.  I wish they revised it to back off one stop of ISO raising (I ended up getting many shots with ISO of 800, 900, 1000, 1600).  I didn't need quite the high speed chosen.  I guess it was better than the other camera we used(the Nikon AW100) which hardly raised the ISO at all automatically resulting in many blurry shots.

Reviews.Title: superb camera!
Reviews.Author: R. Monteclar "musicmaniac"
Reviews.Content: I got a few compact digital cameras(Nikon/Canon/ as part of my little collections of gadgets) and this model is outstanding as with performance, although it doesn't look as handsome or classy as the others.  It's really a surprise to see the stunning clarity of the pictures, as opposed to what one reviewer said. Try this "not so nice" looking camera, if you can, and you would be amazed.

Reviews.Title: Not for people with kids/toddlers/babies!
Reviews.Author: Jenny F
Reviews.Content: Warning...if you have kids and your intention is to capture anything they do, this is not the camera for you.  It usually takes a couple of seconds to take the picture and by then my kids have moved.  When they are moving, it takes very blurry shots.  I'd say about 25% of my pictures taken with this (on auto mode... I'm no expert) are blurry.  Very, very frustrating as a parent.  I've had it less than a year and am already shopping for another one.If you aren't looking to take pictures of moving things, or are looking to take pictures of adults who can stay still for a few seconds,  then this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: best camera
Reviews.Author: lizzy
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this little camera! I bought this for my vacation to Oahu this summer and it takes beautiful pictures.  If you are not a hard core photographer and just want a camera for special occasions, holidays, vacations, etc., this is the camera for you.  The price is incredibly reasonable and you can get free shipping because its over $25.  Picture quality is great, it is very light weight and slim as well. The only complaint I have is the speaker is horrible so the sound quality of videos is bad. Other then that, this camera is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Works great, but I have one small complaint.
Reviews.Author: Eric Jans
Reviews.Content: Purchase price was good, the camera works really well for what I was looking for.  Overall very happy.  One thing that wasn't clear is that you can't take any photos without also purchasing an SD card. A card with small memory is very inexpensive and should be thrown in if for no other reason than to make it less annoying to wait until you go out and get a card in order to use the camera.  My last PowerShot lasted a long time, and included a card (which of course was a different style and size).

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: MidoriTheAwesome
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera i've ever had. I'm not a photographer, i just wanted a decent camera to take decent photos because i love to go on vacations. before, my photos from vacations were dull and bad quality, but now they have nice detail & beautiful colors. i would highly recommend this to anybody who just wants a nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Screen is totally washed out in strong sun.
Reviews.Author: Stanley Berlin
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for indoor shots, but it's almost impossible to see the image on the screen when shooting in bright sun.  I returned this model and ordered a Canon Powershot SD780is on Amazon which has a view finder, so that shooting in bright sun should not be a problem.  Apparently, very few small cameras now have a view finder and I am hard pressed to see why anyone who shoots outdoors would find the ELPH 110HS acceptable.

Reviews.Title: a Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: W. Schwarz "Myfavorites"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on this camera I bought for my wife; she wants simple but with excellent pictures.  The only slight problem is that there is a lag time between when you press the button to take a picture and when the camera actually takes the picture.

Reviews.Title: Great point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: Marq
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera to have with you, as are most point-and-shoot cameras. The widest angle is enough for landscapes and the zoom is useful, as long as you don't need anything super powerful. The best part? It's GREEN!Usually, when I plan on being somewhere photogenic, I bring my DSLR and a couple lenses. If I'm going to be shooting action, birds in flight, anything moving fast, the DSLR is obviously much more suited for the job. Thing is, I can't lug a big DSLR everywhere and sometimes it's nice to have something uber incognito. The Elph 110HS does that.Image quality is pretty good for a point and shoot, at least up to about ISO 800. ISO 1600 is a little noisy and, although it likes to be at ISO 3200 indoors, the image quality at that ISO is noisy. The video shooting is also pretty good, although don't try to pan too fast or the resulting video will give you motion sickness.I only have a few issues with the camera. There is no way to manually set aperture or shutter speed (with the exception of "long shutter" mode). Some people like effects modes, but I just find them... extra-ish.To sum up, it's a great little take-everywhere point-and-shoot camera for the price, image quality is more than adequate for a point-and-shoot, the video's good, and it's GREEN! The lack of manual adjustments for aperture and shutter speed aren't there, but it's top-notch for a point-and-shoot.

Reviews.Title: NO MEMORY CARD INCLUDED W/CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: j. austen "figlicious"
Reviews.Content: PLEASE BE AWARE THAT A MEMORY CARD IS NOT INCLUDED W/THE CAMERA!!! YOU MUST ORDER OR PURCHASE ONE ELSEWHERE, OR YOUR GIFT TO A LOVED ONE WON'T BE AS MUCH FUN CHRISTMAS MORNING AS DESIRED.

Reviews.Title: The slowest ELPH I ever tried...
Reviews.Author: PHILIP SALGANNIK
Reviews.Content: ...and I had/tried almost all of them. Purchased it to replace 300HS, went right back to the store. Even with class 6 card and the smallest image size it is still slooooow!!! Screen is nice, Optics are OK (same barrel distortion as 300 HS). Bought a refurbished 310HS straight from Canon store - a lot better camera, fast, bigger zoom, less wide (so less barrel distortion). Would not recommend 110HS to anybody.

Reviews.Title: elph 110hs review.
Reviews.Author: wayne w zychal
Reviews.Content: This camera is not as good as the model #310hs. It differnedly falls short. Auto focus, slow and not as sharp.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but I miss a viewfinder
Reviews.Author: RONALD O. MARTIN
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip.  It was very small and light, which was perfect.  I had looked at the small cameras available and none of them had a viewfinder, so I selected Canon based on reviews and past experience with the brand.  The photos came out fine except for those where I was unable to see the screen (sunlight, reflections, etc.).

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: val
Reviews.Content: Out of all the camera's i sampled none managed to capture anyone in a more perfect light than the canon powershot elph 110 hs,at the most affordable price and enjoyable size.i instantly fell in love.I ordered it off amazon apprehensive about my first mail order purchase and was delighted at how fast and easily it came in.I've taken countless pictures and havent been dissappointed with a single one as of yet

Reviews.Title: Great camera...but marred by dark shadowy spot on images.
Reviews.Author: 80sGuy
Reviews.Content: The ELPH 110HS is a great little point & shoot camera, it is light and compact and can be tucked away easily but there are a few negatives which I will be pointing out and let me start with the main reason which ultimately ruined this otherwise great little camera. I realized every photo I took with the flash ON emits a dark shadowy patch towards the right-bottom side of the image. If you think this camera takes absolutely great photos, you're right! Pictures with lots of natural lighting and/or outdoor scenes without using the 'flash', yes, but double-check your photos by taking some indoor shots with the flash ON and preferably with lighter backgrounds and you will see what I mean. I didn't think it was a big deal if it didn't hurt the actual images, but all the photos I transferred to my laptop had the problem -- a dark fuzzy, shadowy blotch towards the bottom right! I tried every settings until my thumb got sore from pressing the 'flushed' setting buttons but nothing helped. Then I realized this was caused by the positioning of the flash lens. The Canon had the flash located on the left side of the camera (right side if you're viewing a pic of the product) and when the camera is turned ON, the lens extends and therefore blocking a quarter of the light when the flash is activated. I tried taking a few shots with my left index finger 'doubling' as extending the lens from the Canon and every shot I took with my finger extended, the shadow increases more and more on the bottom-right of the screen. Note that I didn't cover any part of the lens but only slightly blocking a portion of the light from the flash and therefore created this mystery shadow. This further validated my claim and assured of the culprit. The only way to remedy this is to zoomed in the lens a bit.Images looked fabulous when shot outdoors w/o the flash but I noticed that it also inherited some linear distortion and field curvature (barrel effect) on most of my photos, in other words cars looks stretched toward the edges of photos, light poles are bent in, and rounded objects like my wall clock looked oval. I believed most cameras with wide-angle lenses emits this effect. But overall, the camera takes takes more than satisfactory photos. It has great color-balance and very little noise. Close-up viewing (1:1) is still very good without revealing too much noise or artifacts.Regarding the black spot, I am really hoping that this is a defect with the model I received. The camera has been returned and I repurchased another one. I will update the review should there be any noticeable differences or improvement.Cons:1.) The power button: Yes, THE BUTTON (instead of a sliding switch) this causes me to accidentally turned the camera on and off whenever storing or removing from its case. This also happens during removal of the SD card and battery (for charging) vice versa.2.) Menu setting buttons: Works great but they are stiff! Not very easy and doesn't provide much of a tactile feel because they are 'flushed' throughout the panel. My right thumb literally got sore from operating this camera when selecting options or previewing photos.3.) Battery/SD card release cover is flimsy. Sliding it back and forth will certainly grind off the little tabs which will eventually leave it hanging.4.) Zoom (video): Emits a wheezing sound when used rendering your precious materials virtually useless.5.) Battery life: Short!6.) Noticeable Linear Distortion and Field Curvature.Pros:1.) Very compact, light and stylish2.) Wide angle lens3.) Great outdoor photos, or when flash is not in use for indoor photos.4.) Night shots are very good and retaining rich colors such as red.5.) Great HD Video with Stereo recording6.) Separate/external battery charger (can also be charge from computer by using the same USB cable, but much slower).7.) Handles great during low-light situations

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Lynne Wilkinson
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the pictures this little camera takes and, because of its size, is easy to take wherever you go.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Sontag
Reviews.Content: This camera is small, extremely easy to use, and takes superb pictures for a unit this size. Perfect to take anywhere. Highly recommended for a high resolution, point and shoot camera, at at affordable price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Dinojo
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony digital camera that I dropped and broke, so I decided to get a Canon because lots of people told that it's a good brand. I love the colors this camera comes in (I got green) and it had so many features, I don't know how to use them all! This camera is easy to use and I love how big the buttons are, that way if it's dark or something, you can easily turn it on. It takes high quality pictures and videos, and there is a speaker so you can watch AND listen to your videos on the camera. This is a really nice camera for a great price that I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Ananda
Reviews.Content: Auto focus is very good and receive very clear macro images within 3 cm. When you close up, flower show up and flash is automatically off when you shoot. If the flower does not show up on half press, release and half press again. I returned samsung 150 for poor images in auto mode. Good images with just point and shoot auto and cheaper. Small and light enough in the pocket.

Reviews.Title: Distorted pictures, poor white balance
Reviews.Author: GLHM "GLHM"
Reviews.Content: I bought this at Cost** for what I thought was a decent price. I've owned two Powershot Elphs in the past (most recently the SD850), and thought it would be a consistent "can't go wrong" product. I was wrong. If I figure out how to post examples, I will. The issues are:(main issues)The lens distorts faces (sometimes elongating them)It misinterprets lightingIt sometimes produces weird visual effects ("bright areas", "halos")(less important issues)The user interface isn't as intuitive as previous Powershots, but with practice it can be figured out.It takes more clicks to get to specific settings than my previous Powershots.The movies are in a format that can't be uploaded to Facebook, and I had trouble uploading to YouTube.This camera is going back, thank goodness for Cost**'s liberal return policy. I should have known there would be issues if even dpreview.com or kenrockwell.com didn't review this camera. Both give the Powershot S110 a great review.  It's twice the price; however, looks like it will be consistent with my previous Powershots at a price consistent with previous Powershots.

Reviews.Title: Lens noise recorded while shooting video!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L. Stoner "atdogbeach"
Reviews.Content: Has any one else had this problem with the 110 HS? Did 3 test videos - all of them with the same results. While shooting video, the camera records the noise from the lens while zooming! I contacted Canon and this was their response:"Thank you for contacting Canon product support.  We appreciate the opportunity to assist you with your PowerShot ELPH 110 HS.We understand that you are noticing a noise being recorded when zooming during video capture.  Due to the compact nature of the camera the lens is located close to the microphone used to record audio.  Some noise to be expected when zooming during recording.  The zoom has been slowed down in video recording mode to minimize this issue.  We apologize for any inconvenience.I have owned many small digital point and shoot cameras (including another PowerShot) and find this completely unacceptable! Please let me know if you have experienced this same problem.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Andrea L. Lunsford
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. There are 2 downsides to it though. There is a loud noise when you zoom in and out. Very noticeable in a movie. Also, it will randomly go out of focus on you whenever it chooses to. I uses this for daily vlogging for 6 months before switching to the s110 which has issues of its own with the loud clinking and clunking of the auto focus. This is a great all around camera though and we still use it for different things.

Reviews.Title: Slow, takes out of focus shots
Reviews.Author: Katherine Rose
Reviews.Content: I am bummed. I got my older version of this camera wet and so it stopped working. I bought this one to replace it, ignoring the reviews that said it was slow. Believe it. This camera is slow. It also takes out of focus pictures. Not all pictures are out of focus, but just enough to be annoying. I do have other cameras that I use professionally, but I got this one for my pocket when I don't want to lug around more expensive equipment.

Reviews.Title: Diamond in the rough!!!
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon last December for $99.00 with a 8gb card and case with little expectations. I needed something to replace the garbage Kodak camera that I bought. Don't get me wrong, I have other Kodaks that are great, but this one was sub-par.Anywho, Once I started playing with this camera I fell in love with it! I would never expect the picture quality that comes out of this toy-like size camera. With the size of this camera there is no reason not to have this thing on you when going on trips, parties, etc..etc..This camera is about the same width of the iphone and is shorter in length, yet it is thicker for obvious reasons. Some people would be turned off by the 5x zoom but if I want a zoom camera I will take out my D5200, but for general purposes and every day "fun" photography this thing is great. The 24mm lens is a great wide angle, especially for video, which I must say is incredible for the price. The image stabilization for video is amazing and this has the Digic 5 processor. psst...The canon t5i has the Digic 5 too.That alone is worth the buy. I suggest anyone looking into this camera to look on youtube for reviews, there are many out there.

Reviews.Title: Takes great quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Christina M. Gomez
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be happier. I went to Europe and took many landscape and close-up photos and the pictures were just as good quality as my dad's heavy professional canon. Would recommend in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: The perfect little camera
Reviews.Author: Nadine Fares
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to decide what camera to buy for months. I chose this model over all the other Canon's including the new ones. I needed a small camera that I could take to college with me, but I didn't want the size to take away from the quality of the photos or the features in the camera. This camera had a perfect balance of portability and features. It looks great in low light settings, and the quality of the pictures are wonderful. I just can't say enough good things about this camera. If you're debating on whether to get this camera like I was, I say go for it. I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: riki amin
Reviews.Content: I love taking pics. Especially with a 6 year old I am out and around. Beach, parks, camps, birthdays, school outings, events, etc. This camera can take pics very well. Especially the zoom feature is great. And the camera itself is very small and light weight. very cute and does its job very well.

Reviews.Title: Cheryl V
Reviews.Author: C. Vogt "Music Lover"
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this camera for me for Christmas.  It worked great for the first 5 months.  Then a week ago when I turned the camera on, the lens opened but would not operate correctly.  Then it shut off automatically!  And the lens will not retract and close!!  It keeps telling me to reset the camera, but there is nowhere to reset it!  I'm so disappointed.  I wish my husband would have seen the poor reviews before making this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Camera broke after 1 month!
Reviews.Author: Lydia Kung
Reviews.Content: The flash feature abruptly stopped working only one month after purchase.  I've always purchased Canons before but this was definitely the worst one!  Couldn't be more disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected from Canon
Reviews.Author: Zihao Yu
Reviews.Content: There are three parts that I don't like about this camera:1. Buttons are too flat or even recessed into the body. They are too difficult to reach or press. You have to use nails, not your fingers.2. Too much noise when zooming in or out. I even started wondering whether the camera I received was defective.3. Overall the camera just feels cheap and plastic-y in hand.

Reviews.Title: i have owned a lot of cameras this one is awesome takes proffessional looking pictures
Reviews.Author: Victoria vlad
Reviews.Content: this is one of the easiest cameras to work love it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! buy it as a gift or yourself lots of fun

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Henry White
Reviews.Content: We found this camera to be very easy to use with amazing quality photos.  Lots of detail in the close ups and excellent color accuracy.  So compact!

Reviews.Title: Good product 100% Recommended
Reviews.Author: Jean Carlos Contreras
Reviews.Content: Good product 100% RecommendedChoosing this rating because it is a great productI would recommend this product to everyone100% Recommended

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Rookie 11
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my work and it works great.  Couldn't be more happy with this purchase.  Would buy same product again for personal use.

Reviews.Title: love this
Reviews.Author: Patricia A., Sinclair "lazylady"
Reviews.Content: this is a great little camera.  works well, has an underwater mode as well.  I am also able to take fairly nice fireworks shots with it as well.

Reviews.Title: Really Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Brendan
Reviews.Content: Met all of my expectations! Great video quality! I would definitely recommend this camera for sure yeah yeah yeah yeah

Reviews.Title: Greenish yellow hue on the photos, flash easily get blocked by finger
Reviews.Author: Humble346
Reviews.Content: I chose this Canon camera based on the many good reviews but it's really disappointing because of the following reasons.> The LCD screen couldn't show the real color.  It carries greenish yellow hue.  So are the photos after uploaded to the computer.> The location of flash is on top corner of camera body. Unusually high. Anyone with big fingers will block the flash accidentally and the photo will have dark section. Even my small finger sometimes blocked the flash!> The photos are too dark if set the camera on AUTO. I ended up using manual control on most of the photos - it is frustrating and so much trouble trying to adjust functions when I need to take pictures quickly.Don't know if the one I received was defective, but I checked the display in a camera store and the same model camera had the same issues.

Reviews.Title: Canon still the best
Reviews.Author: Barley Brewer "Greg"
Reviews.Content: my third canon elph camera. Always takes great photos. Bought a Nikon last year and hate it , blurry photos. Took the Nikon back to best buy. New zoom lens installed, no better. So I will always buy Canon. Nikon is crap.

Reviews.Title: Canon is the best.
Reviews.Author: Speech Pathologist
Reviews.Content: This camera was a surprise birthday gift for my daughter. She loves the size...compact to fit into her handbag or pocket. Very easy to use - great pictures result.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Kinky_Couple
Reviews.Content: Camera has pretty much everything you need for everyday shooting, lots of different setting which u can manually pick, but it also has auto mode. It will automatically pick the best setting for that shoot, you can actually see the mode switch to different type as you move it around. I love the one touch button for movie mode, very quick and convenient. So for the performance of this camera is great.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase but  required additional purchase of memory
Reviews.Author: M. Virgil
Reviews.Content: Good camera but we were surprised to learn that we needed to buy a memory card at an additional expense, before we could even use it.

Reviews.Title: Ok but not very durable
Reviews.Author: George C
Reviews.Content: Took this camera on a trip recently and it didn't survive.  The screen is not durable at all and the slightest packaging pressure caused the screen to crack.

Reviews.Title: Loved It Until...
Reviews.Author: Dr Bubbles
Reviews.Content: Bought it last year to do videos and photos for our research projects. Great audio, great videos, easy for us novice scientists to use and transfer to computers. Loved it until today when I had it set up for a patient interview and set the video zoom. Thought everything was going well until we played it back. Gorgeous job I did on the interview, too bad you can't hear much of it over the CONSTANT CLICKING OF THE AUTOFOCUS on this video. Now I get to learn to edit audio. Awesome (sarcasm)

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera! [Video Unboxing]
Reviews.Author: Beau Hamilton
