} } } Length:: 1:31 MinsThis is a video unboxing from the HowToAndMore YouTube Channel: [...]HowToAndMoreTo all the people curious as to what is included in the box, I made this video for you!This is my all-time favorite portable camera on market! While I got it predominantly for video recording, the pictures aren't bad as they are much better than any cell phone camera out today. I can't comment too much on the photo quality of this camera because I mostly use this cam for video, but the 110 HS is a quality purchase. The video quality is full HD 1080p at 24fps which gives it a nice film look with it's sharp depth of field and wide angle lens. The wide angle lens is great for 'vlogging' (video blogging) because it captures your entire frame as you hold the camera at arms length. The cons that come with this camera are that the battery is just pathetically tiny and the audio isn't the best but is definitely usable. If you have any questions about this camera feel free to contact me through my YouTube channel (HowToAndMore) or on my Twitter @BeauHD. Thanks for watching/reading!-Beau HamiltonP.S. - You should totally subscribe to the HowToAndMore YouTube Channel =]

Reviews.Title: Macro Function Not as Good As I Had Hoped For
Reviews.Author: Kelli Cox
Reviews.Content: The macro function on this item was not as good as I had hoped for. I need a good macro for close-up shots.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: David G. Beach
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my daughter in college for Christmas. She said it's great! It can do so many different types of photos then just taking everyday pictures.

Reviews.Title: okay pictures
Reviews.Author: C. Keenan "CKC"
Reviews.Content: Based on the majority of the ratings and the price of the camera, I expected much better photo quality. I was surprised by the lack of crispness. It is okay and I will keep it only b/c it would be a hassle to mail it back but I wish I had bought a different camera. This is my fourth Canon (the other ones died through no fault of the camera -- were dropped in ocean, lake and on concrete) and I think next time I will try another brand.

Reviews.Title: One surprise
Reviews.Author: R. Sessions
Reviews.Content: I bought this for myself for Christmas. I haven't used it because it wasn't clear to me from the product description that it did NOT come with a memory card. So until I go out and buy one, I can't comment further on the quality of the camera.

Reviews.Title: it worth the price
Reviews.Author: LIN CHENG
Reviews.Content: it's so good. it worth the price. we love it.it's so good. it worth the price. we love it.

Reviews.Title: not impressed
Reviews.Author: JPX925
Reviews.Content: I updated my 8-year old Canon PowerShot SD700 IS with this Canon PowerShot ELPH110 model. It is really compact in size which I find a bit odd to hold at first but I got used to it and later realized that the compact size is actually an advantage. The pictures are clear and crisp. BUT, I didn't like that it takes 2 full seconds to complete one shot and a full 5 seconds to be able to get a next shot. I recharged the battery again for a very long time because I thought it just needed a fully recharged battery. Sadly, even then, the camera is still slow for me. For regular uses (i.e., taking pictures of people, scenery, etc) it might be okay. But I take pictures of my dogs and before it snaps the shot, my dogs have already moved. My old Canon PowerShot SD700 IS from 8 years ago took pictures in rapid successions. Also, the camera itself is Made in Malaysia and I prefer Made in Japan. I know some will say that this is no big deal nor it is important at all but this is a very important detail to me when it comes to electronics.

Reviews.Title: Good, compact camera
Reviews.Author: Harry Strickland
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a good, compact camera so far. I was not too happy that it came without a memory card, but otherwise I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: mhschmitt
Reviews.Content: I give it a 3 star, so far. Plus I am not happy it is 50 dollars cheaper than when I bought it not long ago. I'm not impressed with it. With any movement, the pics are blurry...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, lousy software
Reviews.Author: CreativeMoniker
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short.I am pleased with this camera, and have nothing negative to say about it, however, the software is a nightmare.Currently my computer is running Mac OS 10.6.8 (Snow Leopard).According to the instruction manual, after clicking the Disc icon on the desktop to open the installation folder, there should have been a download icon to begin the process.It was not present. It is not buried in any other folders. There simply is no way for me to install the software. Therefore, I am still unable to upload my photos.

Reviews.Title: Little Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: SAMFUND
Reviews.Content: I own a Canon A570 IS, a Canon T1i and this is the 3rd one I got as a loyal Canon customer.  This time I am a little disappointed. My 4 year old A570 IS takes better picture than  this one.So the pros:1. Sleek Design2. Slow motion movies3. Vivid colors4. Battery life is good.Cons:1. Grainy starting at moderate ISO - I understand the sensor size is small, but as I wrote before A570 IS was not that grainy -- And ideally this should be better because this has a CMOS sensor.2. Very difficult to change the settings - no dedicated buttons3. No Manual mode4. Less value for money - this capability you can get in cheaper cameras too.Overall, I am okay with this camera.  I wish, I had invested that $200 in buying a lens.

Reviews.Title: Love IT!
Reviews.Author: jgardn00
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I have had several cameras and this is the easiest one to use I have ever had.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: love this little guy!
Reviews.Author: ne14avwbug
Reviews.Content: Small camera, but does big things!  I am having so much fun with this little green camera....I love the quality of pictures, the detail in the MPs, the special features it has, and the size it comes in.  This is the third Canon powershot I have had....and I am NOT disappointed!

Reviews.Title: love this camera !
Reviews.Author: lucky mary "mary"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera ..It is easy to use,compact,holds a charge, and the price was right.  It was everything I needed and more. I would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Charles Peters
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for my wife who wanted a great camera that was easy to use. This one was perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great, simple camera for a good price
Reviews.Author: audioboxer217
Reviews.Content: We got this camera to have with us for quick shots of our new baby girl (due in the next few weeks).  We wanted something small but feature-packed and relatively inexpensive and this camera delivers on all of those.  I'm especially impressed with the image quality although I guess I should expect as much from a Canon since they have such amazing lenses.

Reviews.Title: Fell apart within 6 months
Reviews.Author: Martha Alongi
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing. Did not last six months. Shutter button just fell off. Seller only honors purchases within three months.Real bummer of a gift!

Reviews.Title: Defective, and I Don't Trust This Seller
Reviews.Author: Jaso
Reviews.Content: 1 star for the lack of an option for less than it.Purchased the Canon camera. It arrive defected, turns on and off wherever you touch it.Within the package I found a note promising a cleaning solution in exchange for giving it a 5 star rating.I contacted the seller listed on that note, and guess what - he couldn't find my order.I referred back to the receipt in my Amazon acct, and sure enough found a DIFFERENT SELLER.Got back to the seller named on the note and updated him on it. He replied, now this makes sense, because he drop ships for that company, and "not realizing," he inserted his own note in the package.There was no invoice nor any contact info of the company who I actually bought the product from.I wrote the drop shipper numerous times that I expect explanations, and should I decide for a replacement rather than a refund, then I'll need proof for the replacement that it's a brand new, unused, untouched, non-opened product, and I'll request an extended warranty at the very least, since I do not trust his company anymore, nor the company I actually ordered from.However, I did not get a satisfactory response from him.This raised a red flag and sounded suspicious to me. You get a defected item, plus a note from a different company "promoting" a 5 star rating, while no receipt or contact info from the company I ordered from.To be sure, I based my decision for the purchase of this camera partially on the high ratings of Amazon. Now, you have got an idea where the high ratings originate from.I told the drop shipper that an experience such as this does nothing to foster confidence and security for online purchasing. It was not straight forward and not the right way to deal with an unsatisfied client.I bought this camera as a birthday gift for my daughter, and she wanted to photograph some school events but missed out on it because of the broken camera. While I got the camera delivered on time, meaning on the last of the estimated delivery dates, it was a deep frustration.

Reviews.Title: Camera works most of the time, but has delay and shoots poorly in low light
Reviews.Author: BostonMom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on a recommendation from a friend who had success with it and loved the video feature.  Was looking to replace a fugi I'd had for years. The Fugi was starting to annoy me because of the delay in snapping after hitting the picture button. In the age of camera phones this delay seemed unreasonable.The Canon powershot unfortunately has the same delay as my 5 year old Fugi, and i believe it may be even longer. This is extremely frustrating with a toddler and puppy who cant sit still for a moment, nevermind look into a camera for a mulitsecond capture delay.That aside, my main complaint with the camera is the cruddy low light photos. It simply does not take good photos. This is even more pronounced when there is backlighting, as in, shooting near an outdoor window. You get white light spots but the subject of the photos is dimmed out. I've tried running around turning on lights in the house to get a good shot, but between that and the shooting delay, the moment is usually gone that i was trying to capture.I hate to say it, but at this point the camera is permanently in a drawer in favor of the instant camera phone. It may not have as many pixels but it can take low light photos.

Reviews.Title: Very upset with this purchase
Reviews.Author: blinn
Reviews.Content: Very Upset with this Purchase.  I Have the Camera not even a Year and the Flash stopped working.  The Camera was never dropped or handled improper there is no reason this should have happened.

Reviews.Title: Problems with the camera
Reviews.Author: rus cristina
Reviews.Content: I have bought this product about one month ago. At first, I was happy with it because the pictures are good and it is easy to work with it. But then I started to have a problem with it. The camera keeps turning off sudden after a few minutes of functioning (about 2-3 min), without any warning. When you prepare to take a picture or simply when it is turned on, it suddenly stops even if the objective is open and it remains that way at least a half of hour until you can turn it on again. I tried to get the battery or the memory card of and to insert then back, but with no results. I don/t even know what to do with it, because I ordered it from Afghanistan, Kandahar and now I have moved to another area and it is difficult to send it back for warranty. I spent so much money for a camera which is working for 3 minutes and then it takes a break.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 4 months
Reviews.Author: David R. Collins
Reviews.Content: This was a nice enough camera, while it worked. But now it doesn't. It has been treated very nicely, but hasn't returned the favor.

Reviews.Title: Blahhh....
Reviews.Author: zuzyq
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after I lost my Nikon Coolpix in a house move.  I was going on vacation and decided I needed another camera, I always read reviews and this camera seemed to have good ones.  BUT, after purchasing and after comparison to my original Nikon, I was so bummed.  This camera seems as if you have to hold down the button for extended time and then the pictures come out fuzzy, and no it's not the battery.  Oh, how I long for my click, click, click Nikon, with the beautiful pictures.Should I decide to take another vacation, I will definitely have to go back and buy the Nikon Coolpix.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera...Battery life horrible
Reviews.Author: Josh&Melissa; Bright
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from elph 100hs to this one and the battery is beyond horrible. Lasts for about 50 pics and goes dead. Awesome camera...buy a back up battery.

Reviews.Title: records ZOOM noise - - - stops recording after 10 minutes
Reviews.Author: Ringo
Reviews.Content: I like this camera except for 2 things that have just come up - I can hear the motor of the ZOOMing when playing back the recording and I am sure I can probably change the maximum length of a video recording but it sucks to discover that it is set that way when no expecting it too. Also, the battery life of the battery is surprisingly short.

Reviews.Title: Canon power shot elph 110hs
Reviews.Author: donna
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon camera. I have never been disappointed. Love this camera, quite great in pink!! Takes beautiful pics and video. Excellent choice and value

Reviews.Title: Stop the Wide Angle Lens Madness!!! :(((
Reviews.Author: Valia "aunt.bees.pickles"
Reviews.Content: I have bought Canon cameras for at least 20 years. I am so disappointed in the images of people with this lens - I just took a picture today of 4 people from a distance of 8 - 9 feet away and the picture looked concave with the people on each end of the group looking stretched out and distorted!!!! Yikes! I am disheartened, sending the camera back and ordering a Sony.  Canon, please fix your lens issue - at least offer a compact camera that takes great shots of people! Sheesh!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, terrible build quality
Reviews.Author: Sylene
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for taking pictures. It starts quickly, takes beautiful pictures, has a wide array of settings and is definitely compact. As other people have noted the battery drains quickly, which can be annoying. However I've had it only 4 months and in that time the glass on the screen has cracked in multiple places that it needed to be taped over as there was a sharp edge that could cut a finger. I didn't expect such flimsy quality from Canon.Yesterday was the final straw though. The camera had been sitting over night in a laptop bag (so padded). I pulled it out and went to take a picture to discover that the button that you press to take a picture (and zoom in/out) had popped off. I tried to push it back into place but it popped out each time and was eventually lost. I've had other cameras (including from Canon) that have taken far more for many years and have never fallen apart like this. I don't know if it the entire line, but the copy that I got has serious build issues and while the pictures are nice I now have an un-useable camera after just 4 months.

Reviews.Title: Forget this one!
Reviews.Author: Lynn Harris
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for 2 months and now the shutter won't open.  Called Canon support and they said if I send it back it will cost $169.00!  Guess I am buying a new camera!

Reviews.Title: Shutter button does not work
Reviews.Author: babsey
Reviews.Content: This is the third Canon power shot I have ordered in the past two months and all three of them were defective. The first two were in the 2300 series and neither of the shutter buttons worked. Neither of them would take pictures. Exact same problem with both of them. So I decided to upgrade and pay more for the ELPH series. Low and behold, same problem with shutter button. It will not take a picture. I don't know if Amazon or Canon has a probelm but somebody sure does.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Pissed
Reviews.Content: I got this thing back in August 2012.  It is now November 2012, and the lens spazzes out when I turn it on.  The flash will go off randomly every now and then (and I have seen it do so when the camera was off???)  The camera resorts to shutting down in response, so it is completely useless.  But when it WAS working (and this seems to be a common complaint now that I'm getting around to the other negative reviews) the picture-taking was incredibly delayed and took forever to focus and snap (about 1 to 2 seconds ... sometimes more).  I did NOT drop it in liquid or expose it to harsh elements.  Extremely dissatisfied with this purchase.  Going to Costco from now on for camera needs so I at least know I'll get quality for the price, and I know they'll stand behind their product when it comes to returns whether I gambled with a warranty or not.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, with A BIG BUG !!
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Great camera.Very easy to use, but, must read the instructions.Gives great pictures and video.The big fault in this camera that makes me very upset, is: When you activate the Zoom at the time of shooting video, the sound of the zoom appears at the sound truck of the video movie. It is SO BAD. sound as some kind of tractor. I don't know if it's only my camera...I think it is a BIG BUG in this model.If I knew it, I would not buy this Camera. How can you shoot videos with this sound appearing at the sound truck????? I don't know what to do about it !!!update: Please see the video samples in this wonderful site: [...]There you can hear the noise this camera makes. Must tell you, when you film in a quite place, the noise is much louder !!I was reading many reviews and I think I will try the Panasonic ZS20 or ZS15.I went over many sites and found that the problem of zoom nose appears at many compact cameras. Only the reviews of Panasonic ZS20 or ZS15 (Especially ZS15) say there is not any noise.Watch yourself at these links (Down at the bottom of the page you can find about 3 movies):[...][...]I can't understand why Cannon released this model with this upsetting bug. It's a shame for such company.Update:I bought Panasonic Lumix ZS15I like it.It has not any zoom noise when recording video.The Panasonic is too big.I really liked the Canon but could not stay with this zoom noise. Really upset about it.I really must mention, that the service I got from Amazon was great.When I send Amazon a message that I don't know what to do about the Zoom noise, the next day, they sent me a new Canon camera...I returned the 2 cameras, because of that noise and bout the Panasonic.Amazon = Great !!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing white balance
Reviews.Author: Ramsey
Reviews.Content: Indoor white balance is heavily shifted to yellow green even with the flash. The flash is located in a perfect location to be blocked by your fingers. Outdoor photos are good but nothing so exceptional. I understand they want to make this small but the camera is not rugged. It's not cheap either.

Reviews.Title: Camera was returned, defective.
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Had to return this camera because the auto focus and associated "BEEPS" was inoperable.  Very disappointed, I really thought this was a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Item was defective
Reviews.Author: Corey Bordenkecher
Reviews.Content: The seller quickly worked with me to provide a refund. I purchased the same camera new at a box store and the quality of pictures is great, I only wished the one I purchased via Amazon would have worked the same.

Reviews.Title: How do they do it for the money?
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Mac
Reviews.Content: I'm no photographer, but I can appreciate the range of features on this little device, and the technical quality/clarity of the images it produces. I like the size, the ease of use, and the still/video modes.

Reviews.Title: Supplier fails to refund
Reviews.Author: Michael J Rigby
Reviews.Content: I had to buy a battery for this machine, and when I put the battery in, the lens extended, the message "Lens Error" appeared and camera shut down.  Forever.  So I returned the camera.  That was August.  Have I had a refund?  No, not yet.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS prices
Reviews.Author: Senior Bob
Reviews.Content: I note that AMAZON is now selling this item for under $195.00. In checking around for the latest prices on the AMAZON web page for this item I found the following;Canon ELPH 110 HS $109 Save money when you compare prices on Canon ELPH 110 HS [...] When I checked this site it was listed at $119.Please note that  AMAZON IS NOT HIDING THIS PRICE. It is on their product page when you scroll down.

Reviews.Title: Makes a "clicking sound" when shooting videos
Reviews.Author: Sandra Rosa
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this camera, like I've loved all my previous Canons. I needed to upgrade my existing Canon and was very excited about the 110 HS. Unfortunately I realized right away that the videos record a clicking sound. Some internal mechanism starts clicking as you're shooting a movie, and it gets recorded. Thinking that I got a defective model, I bought the same camera 2 additional times from 2 different retailers and all of them have the same defect. Unfortunately I had to return all of them and wait to upgrade my camera.

Reviews.Title: love/hate this camera
Reviews.Author: S. Farley "annabels gmom"
Reviews.Content: Love the camera, but hate the fact you can't use normal batteries, had to purchase extra battery pack so you can have a back up(more money) so that doesn't make it very convienient to use on the go like camping where you have no place to set up a charger.the camera is small and sleek and easy to use, takes great pictures and videos.that battery part is stupid

Reviews.Title: Great pocket sized point & shoot
Reviews.Author: Rachel Conger
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that can take quick and quality photos, short high quality video, and would fit easily in my pocket.This camera does all that and more.Takes great low light photos.Start up time is super quick.And, it's really cute in red - great color.Definitely worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: LENS ERROR!
Reviews.Author: alicehere
Reviews.Content: I literally just opened it! I was soo excited, and put the battery pack in it and once I turned it on, I noticed the screen turn on and then it turned black with a message on the bottom left saying there was a lens error and I need to restart it. I literally just turned it on and it broke on me already! So disappointing! And angry!! I need a replacement by the 22nd. Was hoping to bring this with me to Taiwan.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: Papet
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst camera I ever owned. All images appear to be out of focus and underexposesd with very soft details and distorted colours. I bought it in August last year and since then I experimented with both automatic and programmed features ourdoors and indoors and regardless of what I tried the rate of success was at best at 10% or lower. For a long time I blamed it on myself and read the manaual multiple times but everything I tried yielded the same unanacceptable results.Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom 24mm Wide-Angle Lens and 1080p Full HD Video Recording (Black)

Reviews.Title: very flimsy
Reviews.Author: Happy Consumer
Reviews.Content: I was excited about the purchase and as soon as it arrived and I charged it up and hit the power button, the camera reported a Lens retraction error on the LCD. The zoom never retracted again, Im not sure if the Holiday shipping ruined it in transit, as the box was all bent up, and the camera box itself isn't "sealed". However I was going to give a second chance to it, but Amazon didn't have any units available to replace it with, so I took that as a sign to g o for something more solid. Perhaps the x260, maybe the better bet.

Reviews.Title: Defective item
Reviews.Author: ignacio
Reviews.Content: I received a defective unit, the most of buttons don't work properly, and the menu button doesn't even work. Image quality is not as expected.

Reviews.Title: Camera is ok
Reviews.Author: Janet Nelson
Reviews.Content: Shutter has delays not as fast as advertised. Was disappointed in product for price. Will not purchase a cannon again

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: S. Lolar
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in Feb after quite a bit of research.  I have used it mainly for trips and have been impressed with the quality of images and video.  I like the feel of the camera.  I *did* find some of the menus difficult to navigate, but once I figured it out it was fine.While on a trip after only having the camera for 5 months, the lens would not retract.  No matter what trick I tried, it was stuck.  And useless.  When this happened, the camera was just sitting on the dinner table after taking a picture of the food.  I then handed to the camera to the waiter and it broke.  Therefore, I had to go out and buy ANOTHER camera.Canon did make warranty repair quite easy and painless.  They sent me a new camera within a week.  Still very inconvenient to have a camera that is not even 6 months old just stop working.  A brief search shows that this is a common problem with this brand.I likely will not buy another canon digital camera in the future.

Reviews.Title: Slow picture taking
Reviews.Author: B. Miller "mrbsm"
Reviews.Content: It's a nice camera with auto everything. This is what drew me to buy the camera. However, when taking a picture there is a delay while it does it stuff which make me miss the subject when its moving.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jildo
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!The pictures it takes are BEAUTIFUL and the color of the camera is pretty cool! it also has cool filters to take funky pictures with. I would totally recommend it! I hope I don't lose or break this one!

Reviews.Title: Complete Lemon
Reviews.Author: FairlawnMom
Reviews.Content: Not sure if I got the lemon of the bunch, but this camera was a huge disappointment.  After hours of reading and watching reviews, I thought this would be a perfect, inexpensive camera for me and my family.  The first pictures out of the box, I noticed a dark shadow on the bottom right hand corner.  It appears the extended lens casts a shadow when using the flash.  I was also displeased with the video.  Zooming between 1x and 5x, the lens makes a buzzing noise as it extends which is picked up by the microphone.  Playback sounds horrible.  Fortunately, Amazon allowed me to return this item with no hassle.

Reviews.Title: NOT EASY
Reviews.Author: Karen Goldman
Reviews.Content: I really can't review it since I find it hard to understand.  I haven't been able to figure it out yet and have not had time to listen to the CD

Reviews.Title: terrible photo quality
Reviews.Author: mj
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera, and have been very disappointed - I plan to return it. The photos all come out fuzzy. I don't know if this one is just defective, or if the lens quality is just poor in general on this model.

Reviews.Title: No user-friendly documentation available
Reviews.Author: Gayle Madden
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the camera and am becoming familiar with it. I like the camera, but detest the fact that the user guide is in a very unfriendly format for printing out and reading. It is difficult to learn a product while sitting in front of a computer reading a pdf.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Jorge
Reviews.Content: I loved your product was very helpful for me and him and I knew already recommended that arrived in perfect condition and I am sharing good times with the product

Reviews.Title: Purfect Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Gadget Freak
Reviews.Content: Looking for a small point and shoot for vacation instead of the SLR... Decided on this one. Usual Canon features, 8X optical zoom works for video too. SO far so good..got the electric blue one...sweet!!!

Reviews.Title: Didn't work for me.
Reviews.Author: M. Moore
Reviews.Content: Before you buy this camera, ask yourself: do I have butter fingers?  If the answer is even remotely close to yes, run away from this camera and find something sturdier.  Or at least buy the drop insurance!  It's so small and light that it ends up being front-heavy when the lens pops out.  If you've forgotten to loop the cord over your wrist and the camera slips out of your hands, it will hit the floor lens-first and you will no longer have a functioning camera.  From what I've read online, what happened to me is not uncommon and repair costs more than I paid for it.It seemed like a really nice camera, but I dropped mine within seconds of trying to take my first photo with it.  Since the damage was my fault, I'm out $130 and would like to save others the experience.  Be very careful with this thing!

Reviews.Title: Review Canon Elph
Reviews.Author: Why
Reviews.Content: I'm not happy with this camera.  First, it was much smaller than my previous camera.  Thus, the components were smaller and harder to manage.  I still have not been able to get past some of the instructions.  Too many features loaded into too few "buttons."

Reviews.Title: Okay camera but not what was expected...
Reviews.Author: MizB
Reviews.Content: I preordered this camera and couldn't wait to receive it. Once I got it, it just didn't meet my expectations. It is very compact which is ok, but my nails kept pushing the wrong buttons. The 1080p HD video is awesome, I actually bought a 10 class SD card and there was a huge difference compared to using a class 4 card. I didn't like how photos came out in low lighting the auto light just seems to not work to my liking. It does take great outdoors photos. It reminds me a lot of the Canon SD1400 IS just a step better. So sadly I will be returning this camera and I'm going to give Sony a try :)

Reviews.Title: my wife loves this camera!
Reviews.Author: jspaz22
Reviews.Content: She has not used it once, and I am quite frankly very jealous, as my cannon is old. I bought it for her birthday, and really she don't give 2S***s! Maybe one day, I will tie her up, and take a picture of her! lol ok, stopping…. I'm sure this camera is great. I have turned it on. We did use it as a family on the Santa Barbara Pier… Did you know people let their children roam naked on the beach there? and did you know, low and behold (brings out the southern in me), there were park workers (perverts) watching, by pretending to talk and work with each other… Only in California… I just stared the worker down… Watch your children people! unless of course you condone this kind of behavior! Then, well……. :(

Reviews.Title: Good photos, but a couple of annoyances
Reviews.Author: Bob B.
Reviews.Content: The first problem I ran into was that as packaged by Cannon, the camera doesn't work.  It requires an additional flash memory card.  And I don't recall that being mentioned in the camera's advertisement/description.  This was confirm to me by Cannon customer support (very polite and helpful) after I fumbled around with the camera for several days.  One would think the camera would have a minimal amount of built-in memory, at least enough to take a few pictures, but not so.The other annoyance I had was the software that accompanies the camera.  I have yet to figure out how to print a photo smaller than a full page.  I've checked through the cannon software and if it's there, it's not obvious... at least to me.  I had no problem using a third party applications though, so not a major problem.Ultimately, the photo quality is great and the camera is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: canon camera
Reviews.Author: Gordon Baker
Reviews.Content: It is much more complicated to operate than I would have realized.  I am not happy with it & would love to return it if I could but I have taken 3 or 4 pictures.

Reviews.Title: Not much of an improvement over a typical camera phone
Reviews.Author: Roman Pennington
Reviews.Content: I purchased this from Best Buy because I needed a smaller, higher quality camera than what was built into my phone.  This unit appears to take really nice pictures when you look at the LCD preview on the back, but when you blow up the pictures, they are grainy and noisy.The manual that comes with the camera is incomplete and not very helpful.  You'll have to print out a more detailed manual on the included CD.  Virtually none of the special features and modes of the camera are revealed in the minimalist printed manual.The camera's response time is not bad but could be improved upon.  There is still a noticeable and frustrating delay when pressing the take-picture button.  Auto-focus is time-consuming.  The auto-settings features is nice and appears to do a decent job of switching settings based on the scenario it detects.The camera's movie system stores video in Apple .MOV format.  This is not well-supported on PCs.  It's the freakin' 21st century Canon!  If you're going to use an industry standard codec like H.264 then store the file in an industry standard format like .MPG instead of an annoying, proprietary Quicktime format!Battery life is also not very impressive.  Overall, I think this camera is a disappointment.  There are some plusses.. I think the wide angle lens is nice.  But there are more superfluous features like shooting in black and white and goofy modes when there should have been more meat-and-potatoes things like BETTER IMAGE QUALITY.In the end, I got this device to augment my phone's camera and the improvement was marginal and not worth the extra expense and need to carry a separate camera.  Canon is going to have to step up their consumer grade pocket cameras if they want more sales.  The Elph isn't cutting it.

Reviews.Title: Can't charge via USB
Reviews.Author: Adam Brooks
Reviews.Content: Many other have comments on the photo quality, so I will skip that.  The point that I would like to point out is that the camera is unable to charge via USB.  I didn't even bother to check that before I bought the camera, because I couldn't fathom that a device in 2012 couldn't be charged via USB.  I find this quite annoying, because now I have to bring the wall mount charger with me instead of just a USB cable the USB power adapter that all of my other devices use.  For data the camera also uses the mini USB connector instead of the micro USB connector that pretty much all other devices use today.  The battery gauge also doesn't appear to function very well.  When I was testing the battery life, it went straight from a full battery bar to "Change battery pack now".These factors won't make me return the camera, but I definitely would not have bought this camera had I known about the charging short comings.

Reviews.Title: price declines only after 7 days
Reviews.Author: aerial
Reviews.Content: when it's not so dark, the lighting will make the picture so dark, worse than my iphone。 too disappointment, hehe

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: thanh
Reviews.Content: dilivery is good, the camere is no problem, but I don't have the wrist strap with my camera.It always comes with the camera. The guide book also shows that the wrist strap is included in the package.I buy it for my mom because I think it's easy for her to use and carry with, she's 60 now. without wrist strap, I' afraid she will drop the camera some day.

Reviews.Title: Proprietary battery & too complicated
Reviews.Author: CA-girl
Reviews.Content: I bought the Elph 110 HS to be a small, point-and-shoot camera.  What I first found is that it takes a proprietary Canon battery, which has to be charged in its special charger.  So you can't just get AAA or any other easily-available battery.  You must carry the charger with you if you plan on taking more than 120 shots.Secondly, it is way too complicated for a point-and-shoot camera.  When I try to take a photo, the screen is cluttered with icons only a true photographer could love.  I'm a computer programmer well-versed in technical jargon, so this is not a camera for anyone who wants it simple.Next, the "Auto" mode decides what it thinks you want to photograph, and stubbornly draws a square around the most inane parts of a scene (in my case, it was my dog's crotch, rather than her face).Lastly, taking a photograph is not just pressing the shutter, oh, no, that would be too easy.  You need to press it half-way, then focus (which it should be doing since it's on Auto), then click the rest of the way down.  Half of the time it takes a picture, half the time it doesn't.  It makes a sound, but there's no picture to be found.If I had time to package it & send it back to Amazon, I would, but my trip starts tomorrow.  Don't buy this camera unless you want to spend a lot of time digging through the manual, and even then, it might not work.  One plus, it's cute as hell.UPDATE:  After using this camera for a week in Europe, I found that a lot of the overwhelming number of icons can simply be ignored.  It takes great pictures, but there is a several second lag between pictures.  Still don't like the half-way press before you can take a picture, and the fact that you can't recharge the battery in the camer, but I'd move its grade from a D- to a B-.

Reviews.Title: canon power shot elph 110 HS 16.1 mo digital camera with 5x optical zoom and 1080 hd video silver
Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: Very cheaply made. It has a very plasticy feel. The zoom makes pictures blurry . I am very dissatisfied with this camera. I expected more from  Canon. Is this camera fabricated in china?

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time or money
Reviews.Author: fedup
Reviews.Content: Can't upload pictures to PC unless I use Kodak software,not doing that,too complicated, too much aggro already.I just wanted a camera that was easy to use without having to waste my time going on the internet looking for solutions to it's problem. Don't care what it's problem is, I'm returning this junk! You blow Amazon for wasting my time selling this Garbage!

Reviews.Title: DEFECTIVE
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: Some three weeks after purchasing the camera the screen on the back just stooped working. Amazon's return window expired which meant I was left with a defective camera. Avoid purchasing this.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Clyde L Bailey III
Reviews.Content: This is strictly a pocket sized point and shoot.  Not what I wanted at all.  Somehow the advertising made it sound so much bigger than it really was.  I sent it back and bought a Canon Rebel - what I wanted in the first place but somehow didn't think I deserved.  That is a match made in heaven.  Since I have never used it - I don't know anything about this camera.  I just didn't like the way it was advertised to do more that it did.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 110 HS
Reviews.Author: cameraselecter
Reviews.Content: I sent this camera back before even using it.  It was very cheaply made I was very disappointedwith the quality.

Reviews.Title: Lack of memory card
Reviews.Author: Harriet
Reviews.Content: Don't purchase this camera if you expect to take it home, charge the battery, and start taking pictures.  Canon is too cheap to include a memory card with the camera; hence it is unusable out of the box.
